216/*
217 * Variable list data space
218 */
219#define MAXLINE 512 /* maximum length of a line */
220#define MAXLIST 128 /* maximum variables in list */
221#define LENHOSTNAME 256 /* host name limit */
222
223#define MRU_GOT_COUNT 0x1
224#define MRU_GOT_LAST 0x2
225#define MRU_GOT_FIRST 0x4
226#define MRU_GOT_MV 0x8
227#define MRU_GOT_RS 0x10
228#define MRU_GOT_ADDR 0x20
229#define MRU_GOT_ALL (MRU_GOT_COUNT | MRU_GOT_LAST | MRU_GOT_FIRST \
230 | MRU_GOT_MV | MRU_GOT_RS | MRU_GOT_ADDR)
231
232/*
233 * mrulist() depends on MRUSORT_DEF and MRUSORT_RDEF being the first two
234 */
235typedef enum mru_sort_order_tag {
236 MRUSORT_DEF = 0, /* lstint ascending */
237 MRUSORT_R_DEF, /* lstint descending */
238 MRUSORT_AVGINT, /* avgint ascending */
239 MRUSORT_R_AVGINT, /* avgint descending */
240 MRUSORT_ADDR, /* IPv4 asc. then IPv6 asc. */
241 MRUSORT_R_ADDR, /* IPv6 desc. then IPv4 desc. */
242 MRUSORT_COUNT, /* hit count ascending */
243 MRUSORT_R_COUNT, /* hit count descending */
244 MRUSORT_MAX, /* special: count of this enum */
245} mru_sort_order;
246
247const char * const mru_sort_keywords[MRUSORT_MAX] = {
248 "lstint", /* MRUSORT_DEF */
249 "-lstint", /* MRUSORT_R_DEF */
250 "avgint", /* MRUSORT_AVGINT */
251 "-avgint", /* MRUSORT_R_AVGINT */
252 "addr", /* MRUSORT_ADDR */
253 "-addr", /* MRUSORT_R_ADDR */
254 "count", /* MRUSORT_COUNT */
255 "-count", /* MRUSORT_R_COUNT */
256};
257
258typedef int (*qsort_cmp)(const void *, const void *);
259
260/*
261 * Old CTL_PST defines for version 2.
262 */
263#define OLD_CTL_PST_CONFIG 0x80
264#define OLD_CTL_PST_AUTHENABLE 0x40
265#define OLD_CTL_PST_AUTHENTIC 0x20
266#define OLD_CTL_PST_REACH 0x10
267#define OLD_CTL_PST_SANE 0x08
268#define OLD_CTL_PST_DISP 0x04
269
270#define OLD_CTL_PST_SEL_REJECT 0
271#define OLD_CTL_PST_SEL_SELCAND 1
272#define OLD_CTL_PST_SEL_SYNCCAND 2
273#define OLD_CTL_PST_SEL_SYSPEER 3

275char flash2[] = " .+* "; /* flash decode for version 2 */
276char flash3[] = " x.-+#*o"; /* flash decode for peer status version 3 */

278struct varlist {
279 const char *name;
280 char *value;
281} g_varlist[MAXLIST] = { { 0, 0 } };

293typedef struct mru_tag mru;
294struct mru_tag {
295 mru * hlink; /* next in hash table bucket */
296 DECL_DLIST_LINK(mru, mlink);
297 int count;
298 l_fp last;
299 l_fp first;
300 u_char mode;
301 u_char ver;
302 u_short rs;

304};

335 char * str;

337 l_fp lfp; /* NTP_LFP */
338 } v; /* retrieved value */
339} vdc;
340#if !defined(MISSING_C99_STRUCT_INIT)
341# define VDC_INIT(a, b, c) { .tag = a, .display = b, .type = c }
342#else

372/*
373 * qsort comparison function table for mrulist(). The first two
374 * entries are NULL because they are handled without qsort().
375 */
376static const qsort_cmp mru_qcmp_table[MRUSORT_MAX] = {
377 NULL, /* MRUSORT_DEF unused */
378 NULL, /* MRUSORT_R_DEF unused */
379 &qcmp_mru_avgint, /* MRUSORT_AVGINT */
380 &qcmp_mru_r_avgint, /* MRUSORT_R_AVGINT */
381 &qcmp_mru_addr, /* MRUSORT_ADDR */
382 &qcmp_mru_r_addr, /* MRUSORT_R_ADDR */
383 &qcmp_mru_count, /* MRUSORT_COUNT */
384 &qcmp_mru_r_count, /* MRUSORT_R_COUNT */
385};

387/*
388 * checkassocid - return the association ID, checking to see if it is valid
389 */
390static associd_t
391checkassocid(
392 u_int32 value
393 )
394{
395 associd_t associd;
396 u_long ulvalue;
397
398 associd = (associd_t)value;
399 if (0 == associd || value != associd) {
400 ulvalue = value;
401 fprintf(stderr,
402 "***Invalid association ID %lu specified\n",
403 ulvalue);
404 return 0;
405 }
406
407 return associd;
408}
409
410
411/*
412 * findlistvar - Look for the named variable in a varlist. If found,
413 * return a pointer to it. Otherwise, if the list has
414 * slots available, return the pointer to the first free
415 * slot, or NULL if it's full.
416 */
417static struct varlist *
418findlistvar(
419 struct varlist *list,
420 char *name
421 )
422{
423 struct varlist *vl;
424
425 for (vl = list; vl < list + MAXLIST && vl->name != NULL; vl++)
426 if (!strcmp(name, vl->name))
427 return vl;
428 if (vl < list + MAXLIST)
429 return vl;
430
431 return NULL;
432}
433
434
435/*
436 * doaddvlist - add variable(s) to the variable list
437 */
438static void
439doaddvlist(
440 struct varlist *vlist,
441 const char *vars
442 )
443{
444 struct varlist *vl;
445 size_t len;
446 char *name;
447 char *value;
448
449 len = strlen(vars);
450 while (nextvar(&len, &vars, &name, &value)) {
451 INSIST(name && value);
452 vl = findlistvar(vlist, name);
453 if (NULL == vl) {
454 fprintf(stderr, "Variable list full\n");
455 return;
456 }
457
458 if (NULL == vl->name) {
459 vl->name = estrdup(name);
460 } else if (vl->value != NULL) {
461 free(vl->value);
462 vl->value = NULL;
463 }
464
465 if (value != NULL)
466 vl->value = estrdup(value);
467 }
468}
469
470
471/*
472 * dormvlist - remove variable(s) from the variable list
473 */
474static void
475dormvlist(
476 struct varlist *vlist,
477 const char *vars
478 )
479{
480 struct varlist *vl;
481 size_t len;
482 char *name;
483 char *value;
484
485 len = strlen(vars);
486 while (nextvar(&len, &vars, &name, &value)) {
487 INSIST(name && value);
488 vl = findlistvar(vlist, name);
489 if (vl == 0 || vl->name == 0) {
490 (void) fprintf(stderr, "Variable `%s' not found\n",
491 name);
492 } else {
493 free((void *)(intptr_t)vl->name);
494 if (vl->value != 0)
495 free(vl->value);
496 for ( ; (vl+1) < (g_varlist + MAXLIST)
497 && (vl+1)->name != 0; vl++) {
498 vl->name = (vl+1)->name;
499 vl->value = (vl+1)->value;
500 }
501 vl->name = vl->value = 0;
502 }
503 }
504}
505
506
507/*
508 * doclearvlist - clear a variable list
509 */
510static void
511doclearvlist(
512 struct varlist *vlist
513 )
514{
515 register struct varlist *vl;
516
517 for (vl = vlist; vl < vlist + MAXLIST && vl->name != 0; vl++) {
518 free((void *)(intptr_t)vl->name);
519 vl->name = 0;
520 if (vl->value != 0) {
521 free(vl->value);
522 vl->value = 0;
523 }
524 }
525}
526
527
528/*
529 * makequerydata - form a data buffer to be included with a query
530 */
531static void
532makequerydata(
533 struct varlist *vlist,
534 size_t *datalen,
535 char *data
536 )
537{
538 register struct varlist *vl;
539 register char *cp, *cpend;
540 register size_t namelen, valuelen;
541 register size_t totallen;
542
543 cp = data;
544 cpend = data + *datalen;
545
546 for (vl = vlist; vl < vlist + MAXLIST && vl->name != 0; vl++) {
547 namelen = strlen(vl->name);
548 if (vl->value == 0)
549 valuelen = 0;
550 else
551 valuelen = strlen(vl->value);
552 totallen = namelen + valuelen + (valuelen != 0) + (cp != data);
553 if (cp + totallen > cpend) {
554 fprintf(stderr,
555 "***Ignoring variables starting with `%s'\n",
556 vl->name);
557 break;
558 }
559
560 if (cp != data)
561 *cp++ = ',';
562 memcpy(cp, vl->name, (size_t)namelen);
563 cp += namelen;
564 if (valuelen != 0) {
565 *cp++ = '=';
566 memcpy(cp, vl->value, (size_t)valuelen);
567 cp += valuelen;
568 }
569 }
570 *datalen = (size_t)(cp - data);
571}
572
573
574/*
575 * doquerylist - send a message including variables in a list
576 */
577static int
578doquerylist(
579 struct varlist *vlist,
580 int op,
581 associd_t associd,
582 int auth,
583 u_short *rstatus,
584 size_t *dsize,
585 const char **datap
586 )
587{
588 char data[CTL_MAX_DATA_LEN];
589 size_t datalen;
590
591 datalen = sizeof(data);
592 makequerydata(vlist, &datalen, data);
593
594 return doquery(op, associd, auth, datalen, data, rstatus, dsize,
595 datap);
596}
597
598
599/*
600 * doprintvlist - print the variables on a list
601 */
602static void
603doprintvlist(
604 struct varlist *vlist,
605 FILE *fp
606 )
607{
608 size_t n;
609
610 if (NULL == vlist->name) {
611 fprintf(fp, "No variables on list\n");
612 return;
613 }
614 for (n = 0; n < MAXLIST && vlist[n].name != NULL; n++) {
615 if (NULL == vlist[n].value)
616 fprintf(fp, "%s\n", vlist[n].name);
617 else
618 fprintf(fp, "%s=%s\n", vlist[n].name,
619 vlist[n].value);
620 }
621}
622
623/*
624 * addvars - add variables to the variable list
625 */
626/*ARGSUSED*/
627static void
628addvars(
629 struct parse *pcmd,
630 FILE *fp
631 )
632{
633 doaddvlist(g_varlist, pcmd->argval[0].string);
634}
635
636
637/*
638 * rmvars - remove variables from the variable list
639 */
640/*ARGSUSED*/
641static void
642rmvars(
643 struct parse *pcmd,
644 FILE *fp
645 )
646{
647 dormvlist(g_varlist, pcmd->argval[0].string);
648}
649
650
651/*
652 * clearvars - clear the variable list
653 */
654/*ARGSUSED*/
655static void
656clearvars(
657 struct parse *pcmd,
658 FILE *fp
659 )
660{
661 doclearvlist(g_varlist);
662}
663
664
665/*
666 * showvars - show variables on the variable list
667 */
668/*ARGSUSED*/
669static void
670showvars(
671 struct parse *pcmd,
672 FILE *fp
673 )
674{
675 doprintvlist(g_varlist, fp);
676}
677
678
679/*
680 * dolist - send a request with the given list of variables
681 */
682static int
683dolist(
684 struct varlist *vlist,
685 associd_t associd,
686 int op,
687 int type,
688 FILE *fp
689 )
690{
691 const char *datap;
692 int res;
693 size_t dsize;
694 u_short rstatus;
695 int quiet;
696
697 /*
698 * if we're asking for specific variables don't include the
699 * status header line in the output.
700 */
701 if (old_rv)
702 quiet = 0;
703 else
704 quiet = (vlist->name != NULL);
705
706 res = doquerylist(vlist, op, associd, 0, &rstatus, &dsize, &datap);
707
708 if (res != 0)
709 return 0;
710
711 if (numhosts > 1)
712 fprintf(fp, "server=%s ", currenthost);
713 if (dsize == 0) {
714 if (associd == 0)
715 fprintf(fp, "No system%s variables returned\n",
716 (type == TYPE_CLOCK) ? " clock" : "");
717 else
718 fprintf(fp,
719 "No information returned for%s association %u\n",
720 (type == TYPE_CLOCK) ? " clock" : "",
721 associd);
722 return 1;
723 }
724
725 if (!quiet)
726 fprintf(fp, "associd=%u ", associd);
727 printvars(dsize, datap, (int)rstatus, type, quiet, fp);
728 return 1;
729}
730
731
732/*
733 * readlist - send a read variables request with the variables on the list
734 */
735static void
736readlist(
737 struct parse *pcmd,
738 FILE *fp
739 )
740{
741 associd_t associd;
742 int type;
743
744 if (pcmd->nargs == 0) {
745 associd = 0;
746 } else {
747 /* HMS: I think we want the u_int32 target here, not the u_long */
748 if (pcmd->argval[0].uval == 0)
749 associd = 0;
750 else if ((associd = checkassocid(pcmd->argval[0].uval)) == 0)
751 return;
752 }
753
754 type = (0 == associd)
755 ? TYPE_SYS
756 : TYPE_PEER;
757 dolist(g_varlist, associd, CTL_OP_READVAR, type, fp);
758}
759
760
761/*
762 * writelist - send a write variables request with the variables on the list
763 */
764static void
765writelist(
766 struct parse *pcmd,
767 FILE *fp
768 )
769{
770 const char *datap;
771 int res;
772 associd_t associd;
773 size_t dsize;
774 u_short rstatus;
775
776 if (pcmd->nargs == 0) {
777 associd = 0;
778 } else {
779 /* HMS: Do we really want uval here? */
780 if (pcmd->argval[0].uval == 0)
781 associd = 0;
782 else if ((associd = checkassocid(pcmd->argval[0].uval)) == 0)
783 return;
784 }
785
786 res = doquerylist(g_varlist, CTL_OP_WRITEVAR, associd, 1, &rstatus,
787 &dsize, &datap);
788
789 if (res != 0)
790 return;
791
792 if (numhosts > 1)
793 (void) fprintf(fp, "server=%s ", currenthost);
794 if (dsize == 0)
795 (void) fprintf(fp, "done! (no data returned)\n");
796 else {
797 (void) fprintf(fp,"associd=%u ", associd);
798 printvars(dsize, datap, (int)rstatus,
799 (associd != 0) ? TYPE_PEER : TYPE_SYS, 0, fp);
800 }
801 return;
802}
803
804
805/*
806 * readvar - send a read variables request with the specified variables
807 */
808static void
809readvar(
810 struct parse *pcmd,
811 FILE *fp
812 )
813{
814 associd_t associd;
815 size_t tmpcount;
816 size_t u;
817 int type;
818 struct varlist tmplist[MAXLIST];
819
820
821 /* HMS: uval? */
822 if (pcmd->nargs == 0 || pcmd->argval[0].uval == 0)
823 associd = 0;
824 else if ((associd = checkassocid(pcmd->argval[0].uval)) == 0)
825 return;
826
827 ZERO(tmplist);
828 if (pcmd->nargs > 1) {
829 tmpcount = pcmd->nargs - 1;
830 for (u = 0; u < tmpcount; u++)
831 doaddvlist(tmplist, pcmd->argval[1 + u].string);
832 }
833
834 type = (0 == associd)
835 ? TYPE_SYS
836 : TYPE_PEER;
837 dolist(tmplist, associd, CTL_OP_READVAR, type, fp);
838
839 doclearvlist(tmplist);
840}
841
842
843/*
844 * writevar - send a write variables request with the specified variables
845 */
846static void
847writevar(
848 struct parse *pcmd,
849 FILE *fp
850 )
851{
852 const char *datap;
853 int res;
854 associd_t associd;
855 int type;
856 size_t dsize;
857 u_short rstatus;
858 struct varlist tmplist[MAXLIST];
859
860 /* HMS: uval? */
861 if (pcmd->argval[0].uval == 0)
862 associd = 0;
863 else if ((associd = checkassocid(pcmd->argval[0].uval)) == 0)
864 return;
865
866 ZERO(tmplist);
867 doaddvlist(tmplist, pcmd->argval[1].string);
868
869 res = doquerylist(tmplist, CTL_OP_WRITEVAR, associd, 1, &rstatus,
870 &dsize, &datap);
871
872 doclearvlist(tmplist);
873
874 if (res != 0)
875 return;
876
877 if (numhosts > 1)
878 fprintf(fp, "server=%s ", currenthost);
879 if (dsize == 0)
880 fprintf(fp, "done! (no data returned)\n");
881 else {
882 fprintf(fp,"associd=%u ", associd);
883 type = (0 == associd)
884 ? TYPE_SYS
885 : TYPE_PEER;
886 printvars(dsize, datap, (int)rstatus, type, 0, fp);
887 }
888 return;
889}

893 * clocklist - send a clock variables request with the variables on the list
894 */
895static void
896clocklist(
897 struct parse *pcmd,
898 FILE *fp
899 )
900{
901 associd_t associd;
902
903 /* HMS: uval? */
904 if (pcmd->nargs == 0) {
905 associd = 0;
906 } else {
907 if (pcmd->argval[0].uval == 0)
908 associd = 0;
909 else if ((associd = checkassocid(pcmd->argval[0].uval)) == 0)
910 return;
911 }
912
913 dolist(g_varlist, associd, CTL_OP_READCLOCK, TYPE_CLOCK, fp);
914}

916
917/*
918 * clockvar - send a clock variables request with the specified variables
919 */
920static void
921clockvar(
922 struct parse *pcmd,
923 FILE *fp
924 )
925{
926 associd_t associd;
927 struct varlist tmplist[MAXLIST];
928
929 /* HMS: uval? */
930 if (pcmd->nargs == 0 || pcmd->argval[0].uval == 0)
931 associd = 0;
932 else if ((associd = checkassocid(pcmd->argval[0].uval)) == 0)
933 return;
934
935 ZERO(tmplist);
936 if (pcmd->nargs >= 2)
937 doaddvlist(tmplist, pcmd->argval[1].string);
938
939 dolist(tmplist, associd, CTL_OP_READCLOCK, TYPE_CLOCK, fp);
940
941 doclearvlist(tmplist);
942}
943
944
945/*
946 * findassidrange - verify a range of association ID's
947 */
948static int
949findassidrange(
950 u_int32 assid1,
951 u_int32 assid2,
952 int * from,
953 int * to,
954 FILE * fp
955 )
956{
957 associd_t assids[2];
958 int ind[COUNTOF(assids)];
959 u_int i;
960 size_t a;
961
962
963 if (0 == numassoc)
964 dogetassoc(fp);
965
966 assids[0] = checkassocid(assid1);
967 if (0 == assids[0])
968 return 0;
969 assids[1] = checkassocid(assid2);
970 if (0 == assids[1])
971 return 0;
972
973 for (a = 0; a < COUNTOF(assids); a++) {
974 ind[a] = -1;
975 for (i = 0; i < numassoc; i++)
976 if (assoc_cache[i].assid == assids[a])
977 ind[a] = i;
978 }
979 for (a = 0; a < COUNTOF(assids); a++)
980 if (-1 == ind[a]) {
981 fprintf(stderr,
982 "***Association ID %u not found in list\n",
983 assids[a]);
984 return 0;
985 }
986
987 if (ind[0] < ind[1]) {
988 *from = ind[0];
989 *to = ind[1];
990 } else {
991 *to = ind[0];
992 *from = ind[1];
993 }
994 return 1;
995}
996
997
998
999/*
1000 * mreadlist - send a read variables request for multiple associations
1001 */
1002static void
1003mreadlist(
1004 struct parse *pcmd,
1005 FILE *fp
1006 )
1007{
1008 int i;
1009 int from;
1010 int to;
1011
1012 if (!findassidrange(pcmd->argval[0].uval, pcmd->argval[1].uval,
1013 &from, &to, fp))
1014 return;
1015
1016 for (i = from; i <= to; i++) {
1017 if (i != from)
1018 fprintf(fp, "\n");
1019 if (!dolist(g_varlist, assoc_cache[i].assid,
1020 CTL_OP_READVAR, TYPE_PEER, fp))
1021 return;
1022 }
1023 return;
1024}
1025
1026
1027/*
1028 * mreadvar - send a read variables request for multiple associations
1029 */
1030static void
1031mreadvar(
1032 struct parse *pcmd,
1033 FILE *fp
1034 )
1035{
1036 int i;
1037 int from;
1038 int to;
1039 struct varlist tmplist[MAXLIST];
1040 struct varlist *pvars;
1041
1042 if (!findassidrange(pcmd->argval[0].uval, pcmd->argval[1].uval,
1043 &from, &to, fp))
1044 return;
1045
1046 ZERO(tmplist);
1047 if (pcmd->nargs >= 3) {
1048 doaddvlist(tmplist, pcmd->argval[2].string);
1049 pvars = tmplist;
1050 } else {
1051 pvars = g_varlist;
1052 }
1053
1054 for (i = from; i <= to; i++) {
1055 if (!dolist(pvars, assoc_cache[i].assid, CTL_OP_READVAR,
1056 TYPE_PEER, fp))
1057 break;
1058 }
1059
1060 if (pvars == tmplist)
1061 doclearvlist(tmplist);
1062
1063 return;
1064}
1065
1066
1067/*
1068 * dogetassoc - query the host for its list of associations
1069 */
1070int
1071dogetassoc(
1072 FILE *fp
1073 )
1074{
1075 const char *datap;
1076 const u_short *pus;
1077 int res;
1078 size_t dsize;
1079 u_short rstatus;
1080
1081 res = doquery(CTL_OP_READSTAT, 0, 0, 0, (char *)0, &rstatus,
1082 &dsize, &datap);
1083
1084 if (res != 0)
1085 return 0;
1086
1087 if (dsize == 0) {
1088 if (numhosts > 1)
1089 fprintf(fp, "server=%s ", currenthost);
1090 fprintf(fp, "No association ID's returned\n");
1091 return 0;
1092 }
1093
1094 if (dsize & 0x3) {
1095 if (numhosts > 1)
1096 fprintf(stderr, "server=%s ", currenthost);
1097 fprintf(stderr,
1098 "***Server returned %zu octets, should be multiple of 4\n",
1099 dsize);
1100 return 0;
1101 }
1102
1103 numassoc = 0;
1104
1105 while (dsize > 0) {
1106 if (numassoc >= assoc_cache_slots) {
1107 grow_assoc_cache();
1108 }
1109 pus = (const void *)datap;
1110 assoc_cache[numassoc].assid = ntohs(*pus);
1111 datap += sizeof(*pus);
1112 pus = (const void *)datap;
1113 assoc_cache[numassoc].status = ntohs(*pus);
1114 datap += sizeof(*pus);
1115 dsize -= 2 * sizeof(*pus);
1116 if (debug) {
1117 fprintf(stderr, "[%u] ",
1118 assoc_cache[numassoc].assid);
1119 }
1120 numassoc++;
1121 }
1122 if (debug) {
1123 fprintf(stderr, "\n%d associations total\n", numassoc);
1124 }
1125 sortassoc();
1126 return 1;
1127}
1128
1129
1130/*
1131 * printassoc - print the current list of associations
1132 */
1133static void
1134printassoc(
1135 int showall,
1136 FILE *fp
1137 )
1138{
1139 register char *bp;
1140 u_int i;
1141 u_char statval;
1142 int event;
1143 u_long event_count;
1144 const char *conf;
1145 const char *reach;
1146 const char *auth;
1147 const char *condition = "";
1148 const char *last_event;
1149 char buf[128];
1150
1151 if (numassoc == 0) {
1152 (void) fprintf(fp, "No association ID's in list\n");
1153 return;
1154 }
1155
1156 /*
1157 * Output a header
1158 */
1159 (void) fprintf(fp,
1160 "ind assid status conf reach auth condition last_event cnt\n");
1161 (void) fprintf(fp,
1162 "===========================================================\n");
1163 for (i = 0; i < numassoc; i++) {
1164 statval = (u_char) CTL_PEER_STATVAL(assoc_cache[i].status);
1165 if (!showall && !(statval & (CTL_PST_CONFIG|CTL_PST_REACH)))
1166 continue;
1167 event = CTL_PEER_EVENT(assoc_cache[i].status);
1168 event_count = CTL_PEER_NEVNT(assoc_cache[i].status);
1169 if (statval & CTL_PST_CONFIG)
1170 conf = "yes";
1171 else
1172 conf = "no";
1173 if (statval & CTL_PST_BCAST) {
1174 reach = "none";
1175 if (statval & CTL_PST_AUTHENABLE)
1176 auth = "yes";
1177 else
1178 auth = "none";
1179 } else {
1180 if (statval & CTL_PST_REACH)
1181 reach = "yes";
1182 else
1183 reach = "no";
1184 if (statval & CTL_PST_AUTHENABLE) {
1185 if (statval & CTL_PST_AUTHENTIC)
1186 auth = "ok ";
1187 else
1188 auth = "bad";
1189 } else {
1190 auth = "none";
1191 }
1192 }
1193 if (pktversion > NTP_OLDVERSION) {
1194 switch (statval & 0x7) {
1195
1196 case CTL_PST_SEL_REJECT:
1197 condition = "reject";
1198 break;
1199
1200 case CTL_PST_SEL_SANE:
1201 condition = "falsetick";
1202 break;
1203
1204 case CTL_PST_SEL_CORRECT:
1205 condition = "excess";
1206 break;
1207
1208 case CTL_PST_SEL_SELCAND:
1209 condition = "outlier";
1210 break;
1211
1212 case CTL_PST_SEL_SYNCCAND:
1213 condition = "candidate";
1214 break;
1215
1216 case CTL_PST_SEL_EXCESS:
1217 condition = "backup";
1218 break;
1219
1220 case CTL_PST_SEL_SYSPEER:
1221 condition = "sys.peer";
1222 break;
1223
1224 case CTL_PST_SEL_PPS:
1225 condition = "pps.peer";
1226 break;
1227 }
1228 } else {
1229 switch (statval & 0x3) {
1230
1231 case OLD_CTL_PST_SEL_REJECT:
1232 if (!(statval & OLD_CTL_PST_SANE))
1233 condition = "insane";
1234 else if (!(statval & OLD_CTL_PST_DISP))
1235 condition = "hi_disp";
1236 else
1237 condition = "";
1238 break;
1239
1240 case OLD_CTL_PST_SEL_SELCAND:
1241 condition = "sel_cand";
1242 break;
1243
1244 case OLD_CTL_PST_SEL_SYNCCAND:
1245 condition = "sync_cand";
1246 break;
1247
1248 case OLD_CTL_PST_SEL_SYSPEER:
1249 condition = "sys_peer";
1250 break;
1251 }
1252 }
1253 switch (PEER_EVENT|event) {
1254
1255 case PEVNT_MOBIL:
1256 last_event = "mobilize";
1257 break;
1258
1259 case PEVNT_DEMOBIL:
1260 last_event = "demobilize";
1261 break;
1262
1263 case PEVNT_REACH:
1264 last_event = "reachable";
1265 break;
1266
1267 case PEVNT_UNREACH:
1268 last_event = "unreachable";
1269 break;
1270
1271 case PEVNT_RESTART:
1272 last_event = "restart";
1273 break;
1274
1275 case PEVNT_REPLY:
1276 last_event = "no_reply";
1277 break;
1278
1279 case PEVNT_RATE:
1280 last_event = "rate_exceeded";
1281 break;
1282
1283 case PEVNT_DENY:
1284 last_event = "access_denied";
1285 break;
1286
1287 case PEVNT_ARMED:
1288 last_event = "leap_armed";
1289 break;
1290
1291 case PEVNT_NEWPEER:
1292 last_event = "sys_peer";
1293 break;
1294
1295 case PEVNT_CLOCK:
1296 last_event = "clock_alarm";
1297 break;
1298
1299 default:
1300 last_event = "";
1301 break;
1302 }
1303 snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf),
1304 "%3d %5u %04x %3.3s %4s %4.4s %9.9s %11s %2lu",
1305 i + 1, assoc_cache[i].assid,
1306 assoc_cache[i].status, conf, reach, auth,
1307 condition, last_event, event_count);
1308 bp = buf + strlen(buf);
1309 while (bp > buf && ' ' == bp[-1])
1310 --bp;
1311 bp[0] = '\0';
1312 fprintf(fp, "%s\n", buf);
1313 }
1314}

1375/*
1376 * saveconfig - dump ntp server configuration to server file
1377 */
1378static void
1379saveconfig(
1380 struct parse *pcmd,
1381 FILE *fp
1382 )
1383{
1384 const char *datap;
1385 int res;
1386 size_t dsize;
1387 u_short rstatus;
1388
1389 if (0 == pcmd->nargs)
1390 return;
1391
1392 res = doquery(CTL_OP_SAVECONFIG, 0, 1,
1393 strlen(pcmd->argval[0].string),
1394 pcmd->argval[0].string, &rstatus, &dsize,
1395 &datap);
1396
1397 if (res != 0)
1398 return;
1399
1400 if (0 == dsize)
1401 fprintf(fp, "(no response message, curiously)");
1402 else
1403 fprintf(fp, "%.*s", (int)dsize, datap); /* cast is wobbly */
1404}

1413radiostatus(

1424 &dsize, &datap);
1425
1426 if (res != 0)
1427 return;
1428
1429 if (numhosts > 1)
1430 (void) fprintf(fp, "server=%s ", currenthost);
1431 if (dsize == 0) {
1432 (void) fprintf(fp, "No radio status string returned\n");
1433 return;
1434 }
1435
1436 asciize(dsize, datap, fp);
1437}

1439
1440/*
1441 * when - print how long its been since his last packet arrived
1442 */
1443static long
1444when(
1445 l_fp *ts,
1446 l_fp *rec,
1447 l_fp *reftime
1448 )
1449{
1450 l_fp *lasttime;
1451
1452 if (rec->l_ui != 0)
1453 lasttime = rec;
1454 else if (reftime->l_ui != 0)
1455 lasttime = reftime;
1456 else
1457 return 0;
1458
1459 if (ts->l_ui < lasttime->l_ui)
1460 return -1;
1461 return (ts->l_ui - lasttime->l_ui);
1462}
1463
1464
1465/*
1466 * Pretty-print an interval into the given buffer, in a human-friendly format.
1467 */
1468static char *
1469prettyinterval(
1470 char *buf,
1471 size_t cb,
1472 long diff
1473 )
1474{
1475 if (diff <= 0) {
1476 buf[0] = '-';
1477 buf[1] = 0;
1478 return buf;
1479 }
1480
1481 if (diff <= 2048) {
1482 snprintf(buf, cb, "%u", (unsigned int)diff);
1483 return buf;
1484 }
1485
1486 diff = (diff + 29) / 60;
1487 if (diff <= 300) {
1488 snprintf(buf, cb, "%um", (unsigned int)diff);
1489 return buf;
1490 }
1491
1492 diff = (diff + 29) / 60;
1493 if (diff <= 96) {
1494 snprintf(buf, cb, "%uh", (unsigned int)diff);
1495 return buf;
1496 }
1497
1498 diff = (diff + 11) / 24;
1499 if (diff <= 999) {
1500 snprintf(buf, cb, "%ud", (unsigned int)diff);
1501 return buf;
1502 }
1503
1504 /* years are only approximated... */
1505 diff = (long)floor(diff / 365.25 + 0.5);
1506 if (diff <= 999) {
1507 snprintf(buf, cb, "%uy", (unsigned int)diff);
1508 return buf;
1509 }
1510 /* Ok, this amounts to infinity... */
1511 strlcpy(buf, "INF", cb);
1512 return buf;
1513}
1514
1515static char
1516decodeaddrtype(
1517 sockaddr_u *sock
1518 )
1519{
1520 char ch = '-';
1521 u_int32 dummy;
1522
1523 switch(AF(sock)) {
1524 case AF_INET:
1525 dummy = SRCADR(sock);
1526 ch = (char)(((dummy&0xf0000000)==0xe0000000) ? 'm' :
1527 ((dummy&0x000000ff)==0x000000ff) ? 'b' :
1528 ((dummy&0xffffffff)==0x7f000001) ? 'l' :
1529 ((dummy&0xffffffe0)==0x00000000) ? '-' :
1530 'u');
1531 break;
1532 case AF_INET6:
1533 if (IN6_IS_ADDR_MULTICAST(PSOCK_ADDR6(sock)))
1534 ch = 'm';
1535 else
1536 ch = 'u';
1537 break;
1538 default:
1539 ch = '-';
1540 break;
1541 }
1542 return ch;
1543}
1544
1545/*
1546 * A list of variables required by the peers command
1547 */
1548struct varlist opeervarlist[] = {
1549 { "srcadr", 0 }, /* 0 */
1550 { "dstadr", 0 }, /* 1 */
1551 { "stratum", 0 }, /* 2 */
1552 { "hpoll", 0 }, /* 3 */
1553 { "ppoll", 0 }, /* 4 */
1554 { "reach", 0 }, /* 5 */
1555 { "delay", 0 }, /* 6 */
1556 { "offset", 0 }, /* 7 */
1557 { "jitter", 0 }, /* 8 */
1558 { "dispersion", 0 }, /* 9 */
1559 { "rec", 0 }, /* 10 */
1560 { "reftime", 0 }, /* 11 */
1561 { "srcport", 0 }, /* 12 */
1562 { "hmode", 0 }, /* 13 */
1563 { 0, 0 }
1564};
1565
1566struct varlist peervarlist[] = {
1567 { "srcadr", 0 }, /* 0 */
1568 { "refid", 0 }, /* 1 */
1569 { "stratum", 0 }, /* 2 */
1570 { "hpoll", 0 }, /* 3 */
1571 { "ppoll", 0 }, /* 4 */
1572 { "reach", 0 }, /* 5 */
1573 { "delay", 0 }, /* 6 */
1574 { "offset", 0 }, /* 7 */
1575 { "jitter", 0 }, /* 8 */
1576 { "dispersion", 0 }, /* 9 */
1577 { "rec", 0 }, /* 10 */
1578 { "reftime", 0 }, /* 11 */
1579 { "srcport", 0 }, /* 12 */
1580 { "hmode", 0 }, /* 13 */
1581 { "srchost", 0 }, /* 14 */
1582 { 0, 0 }
1583};
1584
1585struct varlist apeervarlist[] = {
1586 { "srcadr", 0 }, /* 0 */
1587 { "refid", 0 }, /* 1 */
1588 { "assid", 0 }, /* 2 */
1589 { "stratum", 0 }, /* 3 */
1590 { "hpoll", 0 }, /* 4 */
1591 { "ppoll", 0 }, /* 5 */
1592 { "reach", 0 }, /* 6 */
1593 { "delay", 0 }, /* 7 */
1594 { "offset", 0 }, /* 8 */
1595 { "jitter", 0 }, /* 9 */
1596 { "dispersion", 0 }, /* 10 */
1597 { "rec", 0 }, /* 11 */
1598 { "reftime", 0 }, /* 12 */
1599 { "srcport", 0 }, /* 13 */
1600 { "hmode", 0 }, /* 14 */
1601 { "srchost", 0 }, /* 15 */
1602 { 0, 0 }
1603};
1604
1605
1606/*
1607 * Decode an incoming data buffer and print a line in the peer list
1608 */
1609static int
1610doprintpeers(
1611 struct varlist *pvl,
1612 int associd,
1613 int rstatus,
1614 size_t datalen,
1615 const char *data,
1616 FILE *fp,
1617 int af
1618 )
1619{
1620 char *name;
1621 char *value = NULL;
1622 int c;
1623 size_t len;
1624 int have_srchost;
1625 int have_dstadr;
1626 int have_da_rid;
1627 int have_jitter;
1628 sockaddr_u srcadr;
1629 sockaddr_u dstadr;
1630 sockaddr_u dum_store;
1631 sockaddr_u refidadr;
1632 long hmode = 0;
1633 u_long srcport = 0;
1634 u_int32 u32;
1635 const char *dstadr_refid = "0.0.0.0";
1636 const char *serverlocal;
1637 size_t drlen;
1638 u_long stratum = 0;
1639 long ppoll = 0;
1640 long hpoll = 0;
1641 u_long reach = 0;
1642 l_fp estoffset;
1643 l_fp estdelay;
1644 l_fp estjitter;
1645 l_fp estdisp;
1646 l_fp reftime;
1647 l_fp rec;
1648 l_fp ts;
1649 u_long poll_sec;
1650 u_long flash = 0;
1651 char type = '?';
1652 char clock_name[LENHOSTNAME];
1653 char whenbuf[12], pollbuf[12];
1654 /* [Bug 3482] formally whenbuf & pollbuf should be able to hold
1655 * a full signed int. Not that we would use that much string
1656 * data for it...
1657 */
1658 get_systime(&ts);
1659
1660 have_srchost = FALSE;
1661 have_dstadr = FALSE;
1662 have_da_rid = FALSE;
1663 have_jitter = FALSE;
1664 ZERO_SOCK(&srcadr);
1665 ZERO_SOCK(&dstadr);
1666 clock_name[0] = '\0';
1667 ZERO(estoffset);
1668 ZERO(estdelay);
1669 ZERO(estjitter);
1670 ZERO(estdisp);
1671
1672 while (nextvar(&datalen, &data, &name, &value)) {
1673 INSIST(name && value);
1674 if (!strcmp("srcadr", name) ||
1675 !strcmp("peeradr", name)) {
1676 if (!decodenetnum(value, &srcadr))
1677 fprintf(stderr, "malformed %s=%s\n",
1678 name, value);
1679 } else if (!strcmp("srchost", name)) {
1680 if (pvl == peervarlist || pvl == apeervarlist) {
1681 len = strlen(value);
1682 if (2 < len &&
1683 (size_t)len < sizeof(clock_name)) {
1684 /* strip quotes */
1685 value++;
1686 len -= 2;
1687 memcpy(clock_name, value, len);
1688 clock_name[len] = '\0';
1689 have_srchost = TRUE;
1690 }
1691 }
1692 } else if (!strcmp("dstadr", name)) {
1693 if (decodenetnum(value, &dum_store)) {
1694 type = decodeaddrtype(&dum_store);
1695 have_dstadr = TRUE;
1696 dstadr = dum_store;
1697 if (pvl == opeervarlist) {
1698 have_da_rid = TRUE;
1699 dstadr_refid = trunc_left(stoa(&dstadr), 15);
1700 }
1701 }
1702 } else if (!strcmp("hmode", name)) {
1703 decodeint(value, &hmode);
1704 } else if (!strcmp("refid", name)) {
1705 if ( (pvl == peervarlist)
1706 && (drefid == REFID_IPV4)) {
1707 have_da_rid = TRUE;
1708 drlen = strlen(value);
1709 if (0 == drlen) {
1710 dstadr_refid = "";
1711 } else if (drlen <= 4) {
1712 ZERO(u32);
1713 memcpy(&u32, value, drlen);
1714 dstadr_refid = refid_str(u32, 1);
1715 } else if (decodenetnum(value, &refidadr)) {
1716 if (SOCK_UNSPEC(&refidadr))
1717 dstadr_refid = "0.0.0.0";
1718 else if (ISREFCLOCKADR(&refidadr))
1719 dstadr_refid =
1720 refnumtoa(&refidadr);
1721 else
1722 dstadr_refid =
1723 stoa(&refidadr);
1724 } else {
1725 have_da_rid = FALSE;
1726 }
1727 } else if ( (pvl == apeervarlist)
1728 || (pvl == peervarlist)) {
1729 /* no need to check drefid == REFID_HASH */
1730 have_da_rid = TRUE;
1731 drlen = strlen(value);
1732 if (0 == drlen) {
1733 dstadr_refid = "";
1734 } else if (drlen <= 4) {
1735 ZERO(u32);
1736 memcpy(&u32, value, drlen);
1737 dstadr_refid = refid_str(u32, 1);
1738 //fprintf(stderr, "apeervarlist S1 refid: value=<%s>\n", value);
1739 } else if (decodenetnum(value, &refidadr)) {
1740 if (SOCK_UNSPEC(&refidadr))
1741 dstadr_refid = "0.0.0.0";
1742 else if (ISREFCLOCKADR(&refidadr))
1743 dstadr_refid =
1744 refnumtoa(&refidadr);
1745 else {
1746 char *buf = emalloc(10);
1747 int i = ntohl(refidadr.sa4.sin_addr.s_addr);
1748
1749 snprintf(buf, 10,
1750 "%0x", i);
1751 dstadr_refid = buf;
1752 //fprintf(stderr, "apeervarlist refid: value=<%x>\n", i);
1753 }
1754 //fprintf(stderr, "apeervarlist refid: value=<%s>\n", value);
1755 } else {
1756 have_da_rid = FALSE;
1757 }
1758 }
1759 } else if (!strcmp("stratum", name)) {
1760 decodeuint(value, &stratum);
1761 } else if (!strcmp("hpoll", name)) {
1762 if (decodeint(value, &hpoll) && hpoll < 0)
1763 hpoll = NTP_MINPOLL;
1764 } else if (!strcmp("ppoll", name)) {
1765 if (decodeint(value, &ppoll) && ppoll < 0)
1766 ppoll = NTP_MINPOLL;
1767 } else if (!strcmp("reach", name)) {
1768 decodeuint(value, &reach);
1769 } else if (!strcmp("delay", name)) {
1770 decodetime(value, &estdelay);
1771 } else if (!strcmp("offset", name)) {
1772 decodetime(value, &estoffset);
1773 } else if (!strcmp("jitter", name)) {
1774 if ((pvl == peervarlist || pvl == apeervarlist)
1775 && decodetime(value, &estjitter))
1776 have_jitter = 1;
1777 } else if (!strcmp("rootdisp", name) ||
1778 !strcmp("dispersion", name)) {
1779 decodetime(value, &estdisp);
1780 } else if (!strcmp("rec", name)) {
1781 decodets(value, &rec);
1782 } else if (!strcmp("srcport", name) ||
1783 !strcmp("peerport", name)) {
1784 decodeuint(value, &srcport);
1785 } else if (!strcmp("reftime", name)) {
1786 if (!decodets(value, &reftime))
1787 L_CLR(&reftime);
1788 } else if (!strcmp("flash", name)) {
1789 decodeuint(value, &flash);
1790 } else {
1791 // fprintf(stderr, "UNRECOGNIZED name=%s ", name);
1792 }
1793 }
1794
1795 /*
1796 * hmode gives the best guidance for the t column. If the response
1797 * did not include hmode we'll use the old decodeaddrtype() result.
1798 */
1799 switch (hmode) {
1800
1801 case MODE_BCLIENT:
1802 /* broadcastclient or multicastclient */
1803 type = 'b';
1804 break;
1805
1806 case MODE_BROADCAST:
1807 /* broadcast or multicast server */
1808 if (IS_MCAST(&srcadr))
1809 type = 'M';
1810 else
1811 type = 'B';
1812 break;
1813
1814 case MODE_CLIENT:
1815 if (ISREFCLOCKADR(&srcadr))
1816 type = 'l'; /* local refclock*/
1817 else if (SOCK_UNSPEC(&srcadr))
1818 type = 'p'; /* pool */
1819 else if (IS_MCAST(&srcadr))
1820 type = 'a'; /* manycastclient */
1821 else
1822 type = 'u'; /* unicast */
1823 break;
1824
1825 case MODE_ACTIVE:
1826 type = 's'; /* symmetric active */
1827 break; /* configured */
1828
1829 case MODE_PASSIVE:
1830 type = 'S'; /* symmetric passive */
1831 break; /* ephemeral */
1832 }
1833
1834 /*
1835 * Got everything, format the line
1836 */
1837 poll_sec = 1 << min(ppoll, hpoll);
1838 if (pktversion > NTP_OLDVERSION)
1839 c = flash3[CTL_PEER_STATVAL(rstatus) & 0x7];
1840 else
1841 c = flash2[CTL_PEER_STATVAL(rstatus) & 0x3];
1842 if (numhosts > 1) {
1843 if ((pvl == peervarlist || pvl == apeervarlist)
1844 && have_dstadr) {
1845 serverlocal = nntohost_col(&dstadr,
1846 (size_t)min(LIB_BUFLENGTH - 1, maxhostlen),
1847 TRUE);
1848 } else {
1849 if (currenthostisnum)
1850 serverlocal = trunc_left(currenthost,
1851 maxhostlen);
1852 else
1853 serverlocal = currenthost;
1854 }
1855 fprintf(fp, "%-*s ", (int)maxhostlen, serverlocal);
1856 }
1857 if (AF_UNSPEC == af || AF(&srcadr) == af) {
1858 if (!have_srchost)
1859 strlcpy(clock_name, nntohost(&srcadr),
1860 sizeof(clock_name));
1861 /* wide and long source - space over on next line */
1862 /* allow for host + sp if > 1 and regular tally + source + sp */
1863 if (wideremote && 15 < strlen(clock_name))
1864 fprintf(fp, "%c%s\n%*s", c, clock_name,
1865 ((numhosts > 1) ? (int)maxhostlen + 1 : 0)
1866 + 1 + 15 + 1, "");
1867 else
1868 fprintf(fp, "%c%-15.15s ", c, clock_name);
1869 if ((flash & TEST12) && (pvl != opeervarlist)) {
1870 drlen = fprintf(fp, "(loop)");
1871 } else if (!have_da_rid) {
1872 drlen = 0;
1873 } else {
1874 drlen = strlen(dstadr_refid);
1875 makeascii(drlen, dstadr_refid, fp);
1876 }
1877 if (pvl == apeervarlist) {
1878 while (drlen++ < 9)
1879 fputc(' ', fp);
1880 fprintf(fp, "%-6d", associd);
1881 } else {
1882 while (drlen++ < 15)
1883 fputc(' ', fp);
1884 }
1885 fprintf(fp,
1886 " %2ld %c %4.4s %4.4s %3lo %7.7s %8.7s %7.7s\n",
1887 stratum, type,
1888 prettyinterval(whenbuf, sizeof(whenbuf),
1889 when(&ts, &rec, &reftime)),
1890 prettyinterval(pollbuf, sizeof(pollbuf),
1891 (int)poll_sec),
1892 reach, lfptoms(&estdelay, 3),
1893 lfptoms(&estoffset, 3),
1894 (have_jitter)
1895 ? lfptoms(&estjitter, 3)
1896 : lfptoms(&estdisp, 3));
1897 return (1);
1898 }
1899 else
1900 return(1);
1901}
1902
1903
1904/*
1905 * dogetpeers - given an association ID, read and print the spreadsheet
1906 * peer variables.
1907 */
1908static int
1909dogetpeers(
1910 struct varlist *pvl,
1911 associd_t associd,
1912 FILE *fp,
1913 int af
1914 )
1915{
1916 const char *datap;
1917 int res;
1918 size_t dsize;
1919 u_short rstatus;
1920
1921#ifdef notdef
1922 res = doquerylist(pvl, CTL_OP_READVAR, associd, 0, &rstatus,
1923 &dsize, &datap);
1924#else
1925 /*
1926 * Damn fuzzballs
1927 */
1928 res = doquery(CTL_OP_READVAR, associd, 0, 0, NULL, &rstatus,
1929 &dsize, &datap);
1930#endif
1931
1932 if (res != 0)
1933 return 0;
1934
1935 if (dsize == 0) {
1936 if (numhosts > 1)
1937 fprintf(stderr, "server=%s ", currenthost);
1938 fprintf(stderr,
1939 "***No information returned for association %u\n",
1940 associd);
1941 return 0;
1942 }
1943
1944 return doprintpeers(pvl, associd, (int)rstatus, dsize, datap,
1945 fp, af);
1946}
1947
1948
1949/*
1950 * peers - print a peer spreadsheet
1951 */
1952static void
1953dopeers(
1954 int showall,
1955 FILE *fp,
1956 int af
1957 )
1958{
1959 u_int u;
1960 char fullname[LENHOSTNAME];
1961 sockaddr_u netnum;
1962 const char * name_or_num;
1963 size_t sl;
1964
1965 if (!dogetassoc(fp))
1966 return;
1967
1968 for (u = 0; u < numhosts; u++) {
1969 if (getnetnum(chosts[u].name, &netnum, fullname, af)) {
1970 name_or_num = nntohost(&netnum);
1971 sl = strlen(name_or_num);
1972 maxhostlen = max(maxhostlen, sl);
1973 }
1974 }
1975 if (numhosts > 1)
1976 fprintf(fp, "%-*.*s ", (int)maxhostlen, (int)maxhostlen,
1977 "server (local)");
1978 fprintf(fp,
1979 " remote refid st t when poll reach delay offset jitter\n");
1980 if (numhosts > 1)
1981 for (u = 0; u <= maxhostlen; u++)
1982 fprintf(fp, "=");
1983 fprintf(fp,
1984 "==============================================================================\n");
1985
1986 for (u = 0; u < numassoc; u++) {
1987 if (!showall &&
1988 !(CTL_PEER_STATVAL(assoc_cache[u].status)
1989 & (CTL_PST_CONFIG|CTL_PST_REACH))) {
1990 if (debug)
1991 fprintf(stderr, "eliding [%d]\n",
1992 (int)assoc_cache[u].assid);
1993 continue;
1994 }
1995 if (!dogetpeers(peervarlist, (int)assoc_cache[u].assid,
1996 fp, af))
1997 return;
1998 }
1999 return;
2000}
2001
2002
2003/*
2004 * doapeers - print a peer spreadsheet with assocIDs
2005 */
2006static void
2007doapeers(
2008 int showall,
2009 FILE *fp,
2010 int af
2011 )
2012{
2013 u_int u;
2014 char fullname[LENHOSTNAME];
2015 sockaddr_u netnum;
2016 const char * name_or_num;
2017 size_t sl;
2018
2019 if (!dogetassoc(fp))
2020 return;
2021
2022 for (u = 0; u < numhosts; u++) {
2023 if (getnetnum(chosts[u].name, &netnum, fullname, af)) {
2024 name_or_num = nntohost(&netnum);
2025 sl = strlen(name_or_num);
2026 maxhostlen = max(maxhostlen, sl);
2027 }
2028 }
2029 if (numhosts > 1)
2030 fprintf(fp, "%-*.*s ", (int)maxhostlen, (int)maxhostlen,
2031 "server (local)");
2032 fprintf(fp,
2033 " remote refid assid st t when poll reach delay offset jitter\n");
2034 if (numhosts > 1)
2035 for (u = 0; u <= maxhostlen; u++)
2036 fprintf(fp, "=");
2037 fprintf(fp,
2038 "==============================================================================\n");
2039
2040 for (u = 0; u < numassoc; u++) {
2041 if (!showall &&
2042 !(CTL_PEER_STATVAL(assoc_cache[u].status)
2043 & (CTL_PST_CONFIG|CTL_PST_REACH))) {
2044 if (debug)
2045 fprintf(stderr, "eliding [%d]\n",
2046 (int)assoc_cache[u].assid);
2047 continue;
2048 }
2049 if (!dogetpeers(apeervarlist, (int)assoc_cache[u].assid,
2050 fp, af))
2051 return;
2052 }
2053 return;
2054}

2056
2057/*
2058 * peers - print a peer spreadsheet
2059 */
2060/*ARGSUSED*/
2061static void
2062peers(
2063 struct parse *pcmd,
2064 FILE *fp
2065 )
2066{
2067 if (drefid == REFID_HASH) {
2068 apeers(pcmd, fp);
2069 } else {
2070 int af = 0;
2071
2072 if (pcmd->nargs == 1) {
2073 if (pcmd->argval->ival == 6)
2074 af = AF_INET6;
2075 else
2076 af = AF_INET;
2077 }
2078 dopeers(0, fp, af);
2079 }
2080}
2081

2084 * apeers - print a peer spreadsheet, with assocIDs
2085 */
2086/*ARGSUSED*/
2087static void
2088apeers(
2089 struct parse *pcmd,
2090 FILE *fp
2091 )
2092{
2093 int af = 0;
2094
2095 if (pcmd->nargs == 1) {
2096 if (pcmd->argval->ival == 6)
2097 af = AF_INET6;
2098 else
2099 af = AF_INET;
2100 }
2101 doapeers(0, fp, af);
2102}

2106 * lpeers - print a peer spreadsheet including all fuzzball peers
2107 */
2108/*ARGSUSED*/
2109static void
2110lpeers(
2111 struct parse *pcmd,
2112 FILE *fp
2113 )
2114{
2115 int af = 0;
2116
2117 if (pcmd->nargs == 1) {
2118 if (pcmd->argval->ival == 6)
2119 af = AF_INET6;
2120 else
2121 af = AF_INET;
2122 }
2123 dopeers(1, fp, af);
2124}

2126
2127/*
2128 * opeers - print a peer spreadsheet
2129 */
2130static void
2131doopeers(
2132 int showall,
2133 FILE *fp,
2134 int af
2135 )
2136{
2137 u_int i;
2138 char fullname[LENHOSTNAME];
2139 sockaddr_u netnum;
2140
2141 if (!dogetassoc(fp))
2142 return;
2143
2144 for (i = 0; i < numhosts; ++i) {
2145 if (getnetnum(chosts[i].name, &netnum, fullname, af))
2146 if (strlen(fullname) > maxhostlen)
2147 maxhostlen = strlen(fullname);
2148 }
2149 if (numhosts > 1)
2150 fprintf(fp, "%-*.*s ", (int)maxhostlen, (int)maxhostlen,
2151 "server");
2152 fprintf(fp,
2153 " remote local st t when poll reach delay offset disp\n");
2154 if (numhosts > 1)
2155 for (i = 0; i <= maxhostlen; ++i)
2156 fprintf(fp, "=");
2157 fprintf(fp,
2158 "==============================================================================\n");
2159
2160 for (i = 0; i < numassoc; i++) {
2161 if (!showall &&
2162 !(CTL_PEER_STATVAL(assoc_cache[i].status) &
2163 (CTL_PST_CONFIG | CTL_PST_REACH)))
2164 continue;
2165 if (!dogetpeers(opeervarlist, assoc_cache[i].assid, fp, af))
2166 return;
2167 }
2168 return;
2169}

2188 af = AF_INET;

2198static void
2199lopeers(

2209 else
