2215
2216/*
2217 * config - send a configuration command to a remote host
2218 */
2219static void
2220config (
2221 struct parse *pcmd,
2222 FILE *fp
2223 )
2224{
2225 const char *cfgcmd;
2226 u_short rstatus;
2227 size_t rsize;
2228 const char *rdata;
2229 char *resp;
2230 int res;
2231 int col;
2232 int i;
2233
2234 cfgcmd = pcmd->argval[0].string;
2235
2236 if (debug > 2)
2237 fprintf(stderr,
2238 "In Config\n"
2239 "Keyword = %s\n"
2240 "Command = %s\n", pcmd->keyword, cfgcmd);
2241
2242 res = doquery(CTL_OP_CONFIGURE, 0, 1,
2243 strlen(cfgcmd), cfgcmd,
2244 &rstatus, &rsize, &rdata);
2245
2246 if (res != 0)
2247 return;
2248
2249 if (rsize > 0 && '\n' == rdata[rsize - 1])
2250 rsize--;
2251
2252 resp = emalloc(rsize + 1);
2253 memcpy(resp, rdata, rsize);
2254 resp[rsize] = '\0';
2255
2256 col = -1;
2257 if (1 == sscanf(resp, "column %d syntax error", &col)
2258 && col >= 0 && (size_t)col <= strlen(cfgcmd) + 1) {
2259 if (interactive)
2260 fputs(" *", stdout); /* "ntpq> :config " */
2261 else
2262 printf("%s\n", cfgcmd);
2263 for (i = 0; i < col; i++)
2264 fputc('_', stdout);
2265 fputs("^\n", stdout);
2266 }
2267 printf("%s\n", resp);
2268 free(resp);
2269}
2270
2271
2272/*
2273 * config_from_file - remotely configure an ntpd daemon using the
2274 * specified configuration file
2275 * SK: This function is a kludge at best and is full of bad design
2276 * bugs:
2277 * 1. ntpq uses UDP, which means that there is no guarantee of in-order,
2278 * error-free delivery.
2279 * 2. The maximum length of a packet is constrained, and as a result, the
2280 * maximum length of a line in a configuration file is constrained.
2281 * Longer lines will lead to unpredictable results.
2282 * 3. Since this function is sending a line at a time, we can't update
2283 * the control key through the configuration file (YUCK!!)
2284 *
2285 * Pearly: There are a few places where 'size_t' is cast to 'int' based
2286 * on the assumption that 'int' can hold the size of the involved
2287 * buffers without overflow.
2288 */
2289static void
2290config_from_file (
2291 struct parse *pcmd,
2292 FILE *fp
2293 )
2294{
2295 u_short rstatus;
2296 size_t rsize;
2297 const char *rdata;
2298 char * cp;
2299 int res;
2300 FILE *config_fd;
2301 char config_cmd[MAXLINE];
2302 size_t config_len;
2303 int i;
2304 int retry_limit;
2305
2306 if (debug > 2)
2307 fprintf(stderr,
2308 "In Config\n"
2309 "Keyword = %s\n"
2310 "Filename = %s\n", pcmd->keyword,
2311 pcmd->argval[0].string);
2312
2313 config_fd = fopen(pcmd->argval[0].string, "r");
2314 if (NULL == config_fd) {
2315 printf("ERROR!! Couldn't open file: %s\n",
2316 pcmd->argval[0].string);
2317 return;
2318 }
2319
2320 printf("Sending configuration file, one line at a time.\n");
2321 i = 0;
2322 while (fgets(config_cmd, MAXLINE, config_fd) != NULL) {
2323 /* Eliminate comments first. */
2324 cp = strchr(config_cmd, '#');
2325 config_len = (NULL != cp)
2326 ? (size_t)(cp - config_cmd)
2327 : strlen(config_cmd);
2328
2329 /* [Bug 3015] make sure there's no trailing whitespace;
2330 * the fix for [Bug 2853] on the server side forbids
2331 * those. And don't transmit empty lines, as this would
2332 * just be waste.
2333 */
2334 while (config_len != 0 &&
2335 (u_char)config_cmd[config_len-1] <= ' ')
2336 --config_len;
2337 config_cmd[config_len] = '\0';
2338
2339 ++i;
2340 if (0 == config_len)
2341 continue;
2342
2343 retry_limit = 2;
2344 do
2345 res = doquery(CTL_OP_CONFIGURE, 0, 1,
2346 config_len, config_cmd,
2347 &rstatus, &rsize, &rdata);
2348 while (res != 0 && retry_limit--);
2349 if (res != 0) {
2350 printf("Line No: %d query failed: %.*s\n"
2351 "Subsequent lines not sent.\n",
2352 i, (int)config_len, config_cmd);
2353 fclose(config_fd);
2354 return;
2355 }
2356
2357 /* Right-strip the result code string, then output the
2358 * last line executed, with result code. */
2359 while (rsize != 0 && (u_char)rdata[rsize - 1] <= ' ')
2360 --rsize;
2361 printf("Line No: %d %.*s: %.*s\n", i,
2362 (int)rsize, rdata,
2363 (int)config_len, config_cmd);
2364 }
2365 printf("Done sending file\n");
2366 fclose(config_fd);
2367}
2368
2369
2370static int
2371fetch_nonce(
2372 char * nonce,
2373 size_t cb_nonce
2374 )
2375{
2376 const char nonce_eq[] = "nonce=";
2377 int qres;
2378 u_short rstatus;
2379 size_t rsize;
2380 const char * rdata;
2381 size_t chars;
2382
2383 /*
2384 * Retrieve a nonce specific to this client to demonstrate to
2385 * ntpd that we're capable of receiving responses to our source
2386 * IP address, and thereby unlikely to be forging the source.
2387 */
2388 qres = doquery(CTL_OP_REQ_NONCE, 0, 0, 0, NULL, &rstatus,
2389 &rsize, &rdata);
2390 if (qres) {
2391 fprintf(stderr, "nonce request failed\n");
2392 return FALSE;
2393 }
2394
2395 if ((size_t)rsize <= sizeof(nonce_eq) - 1 ||
2396 strncmp(rdata, nonce_eq, sizeof(nonce_eq) - 1)) {
2397 fprintf(stderr, "unexpected nonce response format: %.*s\n",
2398 (int)rsize, rdata); /* cast is wobbly */
2399 return FALSE;
2400 }
2401 chars = rsize - (sizeof(nonce_eq) - 1);
2402 if (chars >= cb_nonce)
2403 return FALSE;
2404 memcpy(nonce, rdata + sizeof(nonce_eq) - 1, chars);
2405 nonce[chars] = '\0';
2406 while (chars > 0 &&
2407 ('\r' == nonce[chars - 1] || '\n' == nonce[chars - 1])) {
2408 chars--;
2409 nonce[chars] = '\0';
2410 }
2411
2412 return TRUE;
2413}
2414
2415
2416/*
2417 * add_mru Add and entry to mru list, hash table, and allocate
2418 * and return a replacement.
2419 * This is a helper for collect_mru_list().
2420 */
2421static mru *
2422add_mru(
2423 mru *add
2424 )
2425{
2426 u_short hash;
2427 mru *mon;
2428 mru *unlinked;
2429
2430
2431 hash = NTP_HASH_ADDR(&add->addr);
2432 /* see if we have it among previously received entries */
2433 for (mon = hash_table[hash]; mon != NULL; mon = mon->hlink)
2434 if (SOCK_EQ(&mon->addr, &add->addr))
2435 break;
2436 if (mon != NULL) {
2437 if (!L_ISGEQ(&add->first, &mon->first)) {
2438 fprintf(stderr,
2439 "add_mru duplicate %s new first ts %08x.%08x precedes prior %08x.%08x\n",
2440 sptoa(&add->addr), add->last.l_ui,
2441 add->last.l_uf, mon->last.l_ui,
2442 mon->last.l_uf);
2443 exit(1);
2444 }
2445 UNLINK_DLIST(mon, mlink);
2446 UNLINK_SLIST(unlinked, hash_table[hash], mon, hlink, mru);
2447 INSIST(unlinked == mon);
2448 mru_dupes++;
2449 TRACE(2, ("(updated from %08x.%08x) ", mon->last.l_ui,
2450 mon->last.l_uf));
2451 }
2452 LINK_DLIST(mru_list, add, mlink);
2453 LINK_SLIST(hash_table[hash], add, hlink);
2454 TRACE(2, ("add_mru %08x.%08x c %d m %d v %d rest %x first %08x.%08x %s\n",
2455 add->last.l_ui, add->last.l_uf, add->count,
2456 (int)add->mode, (int)add->ver, (u_int)add->rs,
2457 add->first.l_ui, add->first.l_uf, sptoa(&add->addr)));
2458 /* if we didn't update an existing entry, alloc replacement */
2459 if (NULL == mon) {
2460 mon = emalloc(sizeof(*mon));
2461 mru_count++;
2462 }
2463 ZERO(*mon);
2464
2465 return mon;
2466}
2467
2468
2469/* MGOT macro is specific to collect_mru_list() */
2470#define MGOT(bit) \
2471 do { \
2472 got |= (bit); \
2473 if (MRU_GOT_ALL == got) { \
2474 got = 0; \
2475 mon = add_mru(mon); \
2476 ci++; \
2477 } \
2478 } while (0)
2479
2480
2481int
2482mrulist_ctrl_c_hook(void)
2483{
2484 mrulist_interrupted = TRUE;
2485 return TRUE;
2486}
2487
2488
2489static int
2490collect_mru_list(
2491 const char * parms,
2492 l_fp * pnow
2493 )
2494{
2495 const u_int sleep_msecs = 5;
2496 static int ntpd_row_limit = MRU_ROW_LIMIT;
2497 int c_mru_l_rc; /* this function's return code */
2498 u_char got; /* MRU_GOT_* bits */
2499 time_t next_report;
2500 size_t cb;
2501 mru *mon;
2502 mru *head;
2503 mru *recent;
2504 int list_complete;
2505 char nonce[128];
2506 char buf[128];
2507 char req_buf[CTL_MAX_DATA_LEN];
2508 char *req;
2509 char *req_end;
2510 size_t chars;
2511 int qres;
2512 u_short rstatus;
2513 size_t rsize;
2514 const char *rdata;
2515 int limit;
2516 int frags;
2517 int cap_frags;
2518 char *tag;
2519 char *val;
2520 int si; /* server index in response */
2521 int ci; /* client (our) index for validation */
2522 int ri; /* request index (.# suffix) */
2523 int mv;
2524 l_fp newest;
2525 l_fp last_older;
2526 sockaddr_u addr_older;
2527 int have_now;
2528 int have_addr_older;
2529 int have_last_older;
2530 u_int restarted_count;
2531 u_int nonce_uses;
2532 u_short hash;
2533 mru *unlinked;
2534
2535 if (!fetch_nonce(nonce, sizeof(nonce)))
2536 return FALSE;
2537
2538 nonce_uses = 0;
2539 restarted_count = 0;
2540 mru_count = 0;
2541 INIT_DLIST(mru_list, mlink);
2542 cb = NTP_HASH_SIZE * sizeof(*hash_table);
2543 INSIST(NULL == hash_table);
2544 hash_table = emalloc_zero(cb);
2545
2546 c_mru_l_rc = FALSE;
2547 list_complete = FALSE;
2548 have_now = FALSE;
2549 cap_frags = TRUE;
2550 got = 0;
2551 ri = 0;
2552 cb = sizeof(*mon);
2553 mon = emalloc_zero(cb);
2554 ZERO(*pnow);
2555 ZERO(last_older);
2556 next_report = time(NULL) + MRU_REPORT_SECS;
2557
2558 limit = min(3 * MAXFRAGS, ntpd_row_limit);
2559 frags = MAXFRAGS;
2560 snprintf(req_buf, sizeof(req_buf), "nonce=%s, frags=%d%s",
2561 nonce, frags, parms);
2562 nonce_uses++;
2563
2564 while (TRUE) {
2565 if (debug)
2566 fprintf(stderr, "READ_MRU parms: %s\n", req_buf);
2567
2568 qres = doqueryex(CTL_OP_READ_MRU, 0, 0,
2569 strlen(req_buf), req_buf,
2570 &rstatus, &rsize, &rdata, TRUE);
2571
2572 if (CERR_UNKNOWNVAR == qres && ri > 0) {
2573 /*
2574 * None of the supplied prior entries match, so
2575 * toss them from our list and try again.
2576 */
2577 if (debug)
2578 fprintf(stderr,
2579 "no overlap between %d prior entries and server MRU list\n",
2580 ri);
2581 while (ri--) {
2582 recent = HEAD_DLIST(mru_list, mlink);
2583 INSIST(recent != NULL);
2584 if (debug)
2585 fprintf(stderr,
2586 "tossing prior entry %s to resync\n",
2587 sptoa(&recent->addr));
2588 UNLINK_DLIST(recent, mlink);
2589 hash = NTP_HASH_ADDR(&recent->addr);
2590 UNLINK_SLIST(unlinked, hash_table[hash],
2591 recent, hlink, mru);
2592 INSIST(unlinked == recent);
2593 free(recent);
2594 mru_count--;
2595 }
2596 if (NULL == HEAD_DLIST(mru_list, mlink)) {
2597 restarted_count++;
2598 if (restarted_count > 8) {
2599 fprintf(stderr,
2600 "Giving up after 8 restarts from the beginning.\n"
2601 "With high-traffic NTP servers, this can occur if the\n"
2602 "MRU list is limited to less than about 16 seconds' of\n"
2603 "entries. See the 'mru' ntp.conf directive to adjust.\n");
2604 goto cleanup_return;
2605 }
2606 if (debug)
2607 fprintf(stderr,
2608 "---> Restarting from the beginning, retry #%u\n",
2609 restarted_count);
2610 }
2611 } else if (CERR_UNKNOWNVAR == qres) {
2612 fprintf(stderr,
2613 "CERR_UNKNOWNVAR from ntpd but no priors given.\n");
2614 goto cleanup_return;
2615 } else if (CERR_BADVALUE == qres) {
2616 if (cap_frags) {
2617 cap_frags = FALSE;
2618 if (debug)
2619 fprintf(stderr,
2620 "Reverted to row limit from fragments limit.\n");
2621 } else {
2622 /* ntpd has lower cap on row limit */
2623 ntpd_row_limit--;
2624 limit = min(limit, ntpd_row_limit);
2625 if (debug)
2626 fprintf(stderr,
2627 "Row limit reduced to %d following CERR_BADVALUE.\n",
2628 limit);
2629 }
2630 } else if (ERR_INCOMPLETE == qres ||
2631 ERR_TIMEOUT == qres) {
2632 /*
2633 * Reduce the number of rows/frags requested by
2634 * half to recover from lost response fragments.
2635 */
2636 if (cap_frags) {
2637 frags = max(2, frags / 2);
2638 if (debug)
2639 fprintf(stderr,
2640 "Frag limit reduced to %d following incomplete response.\n",
2641 frags);
2642 } else {
2643 limit = max(2, limit / 2);
2644 if (debug)
2645 fprintf(stderr,
2646 "Row limit reduced to %d following incomplete response.\n",
2647 limit);
2648 }
2649 } else if (qres) {
2650 show_error_msg(qres, 0);
2651 goto cleanup_return;
2652 }
2653 /*
2654 * This is a cheap cop-out implementation of rawmode
2655 * output for mrulist. A better approach would be to
2656 * dump similar output after the list is collected by
2657 * ntpq with a continuous sequence of indexes. This
2658 * cheap approach has indexes resetting to zero for
2659 * each query/response, and duplicates are not
2660 * coalesced.
2661 */
2662 if (!qres && rawmode)
2663 printvars(rsize, rdata, rstatus, TYPE_SYS, 1, stdout);
2664 ci = 0;
2665 have_addr_older = FALSE;
2666 have_last_older = FALSE;
2667 while (!qres && nextvar(&rsize, &rdata, &tag, &val)) {
2668 INSIST(tag && val);
2669 if (debug > 1)
2670 fprintf(stderr, "nextvar gave: %s = %s\n",
2671 tag, val);
2672 switch(tag[0]) {
2673
2674 case 'a':
2675 if (!strcmp(tag, "addr.older")) {
2676 if (!have_last_older) {
2677 fprintf(stderr,
2678 "addr.older %s before last.older\n",
2679 val);
2680 goto cleanup_return;
2681 }
2682 if (!decodenetnum(val, &addr_older)) {
2683 fprintf(stderr,
2684 "addr.older %s garbled\n",
2685 val);
2686 goto cleanup_return;
2687 }
2688 hash = NTP_HASH_ADDR(&addr_older);
2689 for (recent = hash_table[hash];
2690 recent != NULL;
2691 recent = recent->hlink)
2692 if (ADDR_PORT_EQ(
2693 &addr_older,
2694 &recent->addr))
2695 break;
2696 if (NULL == recent) {
2697 fprintf(stderr,
2698 "addr.older %s not in hash table\n",
2699 val);
2700 goto cleanup_return;
2701 }
2702 if (!L_ISEQU(&last_older,
2703 &recent->last)) {
2704 fprintf(stderr,
2705 "last.older %08x.%08x mismatches %08x.%08x expected.\n",
2706 last_older.l_ui,
2707 last_older.l_uf,
2708 recent->last.l_ui,
2709 recent->last.l_uf);
2710 goto cleanup_return;
2711 }
2712 have_addr_older = TRUE;
2713 } else if (1 != sscanf(tag, "addr.%d", &si)
2714 || si != ci)
2715 goto nomatch;
2716 else if (decodenetnum(val, &mon->addr))
2717 MGOT(MRU_GOT_ADDR);
2718 break;
2719
2720 case 'l':
2721 if (!strcmp(tag, "last.older")) {
2722 if ('0' != val[0] ||
2723 'x' != val[1] ||
2724 !hextolfp(val + 2, &last_older)) {
2725 fprintf(stderr,
2726 "last.older %s garbled\n",
2727 val);
2728 goto cleanup_return;
2729 }
2730 have_last_older = TRUE;
2731 } else if (!strcmp(tag, "last.newest")) {
2732 if (0 != got) {
2733 fprintf(stderr,
2734 "last.newest %s before complete row, got = 0x%x\n",
2735 val, (u_int)got);
2736 goto cleanup_return;
2737 }
2738 if (!have_now) {
2739 fprintf(stderr,
2740 "last.newest %s before now=\n",
2741 val);
2742 goto cleanup_return;
2743 }
2744 head = HEAD_DLIST(mru_list, mlink);
2745 if (NULL != head) {
2746 if ('0' != val[0] ||
2747 'x' != val[1] ||
2748 !hextolfp(val + 2, &newest) ||
2749 !L_ISEQU(&newest,
2750 &head->last)) {
2751 fprintf(stderr,
2752 "last.newest %s mismatches %08x.%08x",
2753 val,
2754 head->last.l_ui,
2755 head->last.l_uf);
2756 goto cleanup_return;
2757 }
2758 }
2759 list_complete = TRUE;
2760 } else if (1 != sscanf(tag, "last.%d", &si) ||
2761 si != ci || '0' != val[0] ||
2762 'x' != val[1] ||
2763 !hextolfp(val + 2, &mon->last)) {
2764 goto nomatch;
2765 } else {
2766 MGOT(MRU_GOT_LAST);
2767 /*
2768 * allow interrupted retrieval,
2769 * using most recent retrieved
2770 * entry's last seen timestamp
2771 * as the end of operation.
2772 */
2773 *pnow = mon->last;
2774 }
2775 break;
2776
2777 case 'f':
2778 if (1 != sscanf(tag, "first.%d", &si) ||
2779 si != ci || '0' != val[0] ||
2780 'x' != val[1] ||
2781 !hextolfp(val + 2, &mon->first))
2782 goto nomatch;
2783 MGOT(MRU_GOT_FIRST);
2784 break;
2785
2786 case 'n':
2787 if (!strcmp(tag, "nonce")) {
2788 strlcpy(nonce, val, sizeof(nonce));
2789 nonce_uses = 0;
2790 break; /* case */
2791 } else if (strcmp(tag, "now") ||
2792 '0' != val[0] ||
2793 'x' != val[1] ||
2794 !hextolfp(val + 2, pnow))
2795 goto nomatch;
2796 have_now = TRUE;
2797 break;
2798
2799 case 'c':
2800 if (1 != sscanf(tag, "ct.%d", &si) ||
2801 si != ci ||
2802 1 != sscanf(val, "%d", &mon->count)
2803 || mon->count < 1)
2804 goto nomatch;
2805 MGOT(MRU_GOT_COUNT);
2806 break;
2807
2808 case 'm':
2809 if (1 != sscanf(tag, "mv.%d", &si) ||
2810 si != ci ||
2811 1 != sscanf(val, "%d", &mv))
2812 goto nomatch;
2813 mon->mode = PKT_MODE(mv);
2814 mon->ver = PKT_VERSION(mv);
2815 MGOT(MRU_GOT_MV);
2816 break;
2817
2818 case 'r':
2819 if (1 != sscanf(tag, "rs.%d", &si) ||
2820 si != ci ||
2821 1 != sscanf(val, "0x%hx", &mon->rs))
2822 goto nomatch;
2823 MGOT(MRU_GOT_RS);
2824 break;
2825
2826 default:
2827 nomatch:
2828 /* empty stmt */ ;
2829 /* ignore unknown tags */
2830 }
2831 }
2832 if (have_now)
2833 list_complete = TRUE;
2834 if (list_complete) {
2835 INSIST(0 == ri || have_addr_older);
2836 }
2837 if (mrulist_interrupted) {
2838 printf("mrulist retrieval interrupted by operator.\n"
2839 "Displaying partial client list.\n");
2840 fflush(stdout);
2841 }
2842 if (list_complete || mrulist_interrupted) {
2843 fprintf(stderr,
2844 "\rRetrieved %u unique MRU entries and %u updates.\n",
2845 mru_count, mru_dupes);
2846 fflush(stderr);
2847 break;
2848 }
2849 if (time(NULL) >= next_report) {
2850 next_report += MRU_REPORT_SECS;
2851 fprintf(stderr, "\r%u (%u updates) ", mru_count,
2852 mru_dupes);
2853 fflush(stderr);
2854 }
2855
2856 /*
2857 * Snooze for a bit between queries to let ntpd catch
2858 * up with other duties.
2859 */
2860#ifdef SYS_WINNT
2861 Sleep(sleep_msecs);
2862#elif !defined(HAVE_NANOSLEEP)
2863 sleep((sleep_msecs / 1000) + 1);
2864#else
2865 {
2866 struct timespec interv = { 0,
2867 1000 * sleep_msecs };
2868 nanosleep(&interv, NULL);
2869 }
2870#endif
2871 /*
2872 * If there were no errors, increase the number of rows
2873 * to a maximum of 3 * MAXFRAGS (the most packets ntpq
2874 * can handle in one response), on the assumption that
2875 * no less than 3 rows fit in each packet, capped at
2876 * our best guess at the server's row limit.
2877 */
2878 if (!qres) {
2879 if (cap_frags) {
2880 frags = min(MAXFRAGS, frags + 1);
2881 } else {
2882 limit = min3(3 * MAXFRAGS,
2883 ntpd_row_limit,
2884 max(limit + 1,
2885 limit * 33 / 32));
2886 }
2887 }
2888 /*
2889 * prepare next query with as many address and last-seen
2890 * timestamps as will fit in a single packet.
2891 */
2892 req = req_buf;
2893 req_end = req_buf + sizeof(req_buf);
2894#define REQ_ROOM (req_end - req)
2895 snprintf(req, REQ_ROOM, "nonce=%s, %s=%d%s", nonce,
2896 (cap_frags)
2897 ? "frags"
2898 : "limit",
2899 (cap_frags)
2900 ? frags
2901 : limit,
2902 parms);
2903 req += strlen(req);
2904 nonce_uses++;
2905 if (nonce_uses >= 4) {
2906 if (!fetch_nonce(nonce, sizeof(nonce)))
2907 goto cleanup_return;
2908 nonce_uses = 0;
2909 }
2910
2911
2912 for (ri = 0, recent = HEAD_DLIST(mru_list, mlink);
2913 recent != NULL;
2914 ri++, recent = NEXT_DLIST(mru_list, recent, mlink)) {
2915
2916 snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf),
2917 ", addr.%d=%s, last.%d=0x%08x.%08x",
2918 ri, sptoa(&recent->addr), ri,
2919 recent->last.l_ui, recent->last.l_uf);
2920 chars = strlen(buf);
2921 if ((size_t)REQ_ROOM <= chars)
2922 break;
2923 memcpy(req, buf, chars + 1);
2924 req += chars;
2925 }
2926 }
2927
2928 c_mru_l_rc = TRUE;
2929 goto retain_hash_table;
2930
2931cleanup_return:
2932 free(hash_table);
2933 hash_table = NULL;
2934
2935retain_hash_table:
2936 if (mon != NULL)
2937 free(mon);
2938
2939 return c_mru_l_rc;
2940}
2941
2942
2943/*
2944 * qcmp_mru_addr - sort MRU entries by remote address.
2945 *
2946 * All IPv4 addresses sort before any IPv6, addresses are sorted by
2947 * value within address family.
2948 */
2949static int
2950qcmp_mru_addr(
2951 const void *v1,
2952 const void *v2
2953 )
2954{
2955 const mru * const * ppm1 = v1;
2956 const mru * const * ppm2 = v2;
2957 const mru * pm1;
2958 const mru * pm2;
2959 u_short af1;
2960 u_short af2;
2961 size_t cmplen;
2962 size_t addr_off;
2963
2964 pm1 = *ppm1;
2965 pm2 = *ppm2;
2966
2967 af1 = AF(&pm1->addr);
2968 af2 = AF(&pm2->addr);
2969
2970 if (af1 != af2)
2971 return (AF_INET == af1)
2972 ? -1
2973 : 1;
2974
2975 cmplen = SIZEOF_INADDR(af1);
2976 addr_off = (AF_INET == af1)
2977 ? offsetof(struct sockaddr_in, sin_addr)
2978 : offsetof(struct sockaddr_in6, sin6_addr);
2979
2980 return memcmp((const char *)&pm1->addr + addr_off,
2981 (const char *)&pm2->addr + addr_off,
2982 cmplen);
2983}
2984
2985
2986static int
2987qcmp_mru_r_addr(
2988 const void *v1,
2989 const void *v2
2990 )
2991{
2992 return -qcmp_mru_addr(v1, v2);
2993}
2994
2995
2996/*
2997 * qcmp_mru_count - sort MRU entries by times seen (hit count).
2998 */
2999static int
3000qcmp_mru_count(
3001 const void *v1,
3002 const void *v2
3003 )
3004{
3005 const mru * const * ppm1 = v1;
3006 const mru * const * ppm2 = v2;
3007 const mru * pm1;
3008 const mru * pm2;
3009
3010 pm1 = *ppm1;
3011 pm2 = *ppm2;
3012
3013 return (pm1->count < pm2->count)
3014 ? -1
3015 : ((pm1->count == pm2->count)
3016 ? 0
3017 : 1);
3018}
3019
3020
3021static int
3022qcmp_mru_r_count(
3023 const void *v1,
3024 const void *v2
3025 )
3026{
3027 return -qcmp_mru_count(v1, v2);
3028}
3029
3030
3031/*
3032 * qcmp_mru_avgint - sort MRU entries by average interval.
3033 */
3034static int
3035qcmp_mru_avgint(
3036 const void *v1,
3037 const void *v2
3038 )
3039{
3040 const mru * const * ppm1 = v1;
3041 const mru * const * ppm2 = v2;
3042 const mru * pm1;
3043 const mru * pm2;
3044 l_fp interval;
3045 double avg1;
3046 double avg2;
3047
3048 pm1 = *ppm1;
3049 pm2 = *ppm2;
3050
3051 interval = pm1->last;
3052 L_SUB(&interval, &pm1->first);
3053 LFPTOD(&interval, avg1);
3054 avg1 /= pm1->count;
3055
3056 interval = pm2->last;
3057 L_SUB(&interval, &pm2->first);
3058 LFPTOD(&interval, avg2);
3059 avg2 /= pm2->count;
3060
3061 if (avg1 < avg2)
3062 return -1;
3063 else if (avg1 > avg2)
3064 return 1;
3065
3066 /* secondary sort on lstint - rarely tested */
3067 if (L_ISEQU(&pm1->last, &pm2->last))
3068 return 0;
3069 else if (L_ISGEQ(&pm1->last, &pm2->last))
3070 return -1;
3071 else
3072 return 1;
3073}
3074
3075
3076static int
3077qcmp_mru_r_avgint(
3078 const void *v1,
3079 const void *v2
3080 )
3081{
3082 return -qcmp_mru_avgint(v1, v2);
3083}
3084
3085
3086/*
3087 * mrulist - ntpq's mrulist command to fetch an arbitrarily large Most
3088 * Recently Used (seen) remote address list from ntpd.
3089 *
3090 * Similar to ntpdc's monlist command, but not limited to a single
3091 * request/response, and thereby not limited to a few hundred remote
3092 * addresses.
3093 *
3094 * See ntpd/ntp_control.c read_mru_list() for comments on the way
3095 * CTL_OP_READ_MRU is designed to be used.
3096 *
3097 * mrulist intentionally differs from monlist in the way the avgint
3098 * column is calculated. monlist includes the time after the last
3099 * packet from the client until the monlist query time in the average,
3100 * while mrulist excludes it. That is, monlist's average interval grows
3101 * over time for remote addresses not heard from in some time, while it
3102 * remains unchanged in mrulist. This also affects the avgint value for
3103 * entries representing a single packet, with identical first and last
3104 * timestamps. mrulist shows 0 avgint, monlist shows a value identical
3105 * to lstint.
3106 */
3107static void
3108mrulist(
3109 struct parse * pcmd,
3110 FILE * fp
3111 )
3112{
3113 const char mincount_eq[] = "mincount=";
3114 const char resall_eq[] = "resall=";
3115 const char resany_eq[] = "resany=";
3116 const char maxlstint_eq[] = "maxlstint=";
3117 const char laddr_eq[] = "laddr=";
3118 const char sort_eq[] = "sort=";
3119 mru_sort_order order;
3120 size_t n;
3121 char parms_buf[128];
3122 char buf[24];
3123 char *parms;
3124 const char *arg;
3125 size_t cb;
3126 mru **sorted;
3127 mru **ppentry;
3128 mru *recent;
3129 l_fp now;
3130 l_fp interval;
3131 double favgint;
3132 double flstint;
3133 int avgint;
3134 int lstint;
3135 size_t i;
3136
3137 mrulist_interrupted = FALSE;
3138 push_ctrl_c_handler(&mrulist_ctrl_c_hook);
3139 fprintf(stderr,
3140 "Ctrl-C will stop MRU retrieval and display partial results.\n");
3141 fflush(stderr);
3142
3143 order = MRUSORT_DEF;
3144 parms_buf[0] = '\0';
3145 parms = parms_buf;
3146 for (i = 0; i < pcmd->nargs; i++) {
3147 arg = pcmd->argval[i].string;
3148 if (arg != NULL) {
3149 cb = strlen(arg) + 1;
3150 if ((!strncmp(resall_eq, arg, sizeof(resall_eq)
3151 - 1) || !strncmp(resany_eq, arg,
3152 sizeof(resany_eq) - 1) || !strncmp(
3153 mincount_eq, arg, sizeof(mincount_eq) - 1)
3154 || !strncmp(laddr_eq, arg, sizeof(laddr_eq)
3155 - 1) || !strncmp(maxlstint_eq, arg,
3156 sizeof(laddr_eq) - 1)) && parms + cb + 2 <=
3157 parms_buf + sizeof(parms_buf)) {
3158 /* these are passed intact to ntpd */
3159 memcpy(parms, ", ", 2);
3160 parms += 2;
3161 memcpy(parms, arg, cb);
3162 parms += cb - 1;
3163 } else if (!strncmp(sort_eq, arg,
3164 sizeof(sort_eq) - 1)) {
3165 arg += sizeof(sort_eq) - 1;
3166 for (n = 0;
3167 n < COUNTOF(mru_sort_keywords);
3168 n++)
3169 if (!strcmp(mru_sort_keywords[n],
3170 arg))
3171 break;
3172 if (n < COUNTOF(mru_sort_keywords))
3173 order = n;
3174 } else if (!strcmp("limited", arg) ||
3175 !strcmp("kod", arg)) {
3176 /* transform to resany=... */
3177 snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf),
3178 ", resany=0x%x",
3179 ('k' == arg[0])
3180 ? RES_KOD
3181 : RES_LIMITED);
3182 cb = 1 + strlen(buf);
3183 if (parms + cb <
3184 parms_buf + sizeof(parms_buf)) {
3185 memcpy(parms, buf, cb);
3186 parms += cb - 1;
3187 }
3188 } else
3189 fprintf(stderr,
3190 "ignoring unrecognized mrulist parameter: %s\n",
3191 arg);
3192 }
3193 }
3194 parms = parms_buf;
3195
3196 if (!collect_mru_list(parms, &now))
3197 return;
3198
3199 /* display the results */
3200 if (rawmode)
3201 goto cleanup_return;
3202
3203 /* construct an array of entry pointers in default order */
3204 sorted = eallocarray(mru_count, sizeof(*sorted));
3205 ppentry = sorted;
3206 if (MRUSORT_R_DEF != order) {
3207 ITER_DLIST_BEGIN(mru_list, recent, mlink, mru)
3208 INSIST(ppentry < sorted + mru_count);
3209 *ppentry = recent;
3210 ppentry++;
3211 ITER_DLIST_END()
3212 } else {
3213 REV_ITER_DLIST_BEGIN(mru_list, recent, mlink, mru)
3214 INSIST(ppentry < sorted + mru_count);
3215 *ppentry = recent;
3216 ppentry++;
3217 REV_ITER_DLIST_END()
3218 }
3219
3220 if (ppentry - sorted != (int)mru_count) {
3221 fprintf(stderr,
3222 "mru_count %u should match MRU list depth %ld.\n",
3223 mru_count, (long)(ppentry - sorted));
3224 free(sorted);
3225 goto cleanup_return;
3226 }
3227
3228 /* re-sort sorted[] if not default or reverse default */
3229 if (MRUSORT_R_DEF < order)
3230 qsort(sorted, mru_count, sizeof(sorted[0]),
3231 mru_qcmp_table[order]);
3232
3233 mrulist_interrupted = FALSE;
3234 printf( "lstint avgint rstr r m v count rport remote address\n"
3235 "==============================================================================\n");
3236 /* '=' x 78 */
3237 for (ppentry = sorted; ppentry < sorted + mru_count; ppentry++) {
3238 recent = *ppentry;
3239 interval = now;
3240 L_SUB(&interval, &recent->last);
3241 LFPTOD(&interval, flstint);
3242 lstint = (int)(flstint + 0.5);
3243 interval = recent->last;
3244 L_SUB(&interval, &recent->first);
3245 LFPTOD(&interval, favgint);
3246 favgint /= recent->count;
3247 avgint = (int)(favgint + 0.5);
3248 fprintf(fp, "%6d %6d %4hx %c %d %d %6d %5u %s\n",
3249 lstint, avgint, recent->rs,
3250 (RES_KOD & recent->rs)
3251 ? 'K'
3252 : (RES_LIMITED & recent->rs)
3253 ? 'L'
3254 : '.',
3255 (int)recent->mode, (int)recent->ver,
3256 recent->count, SRCPORT(&recent->addr),
3257 nntohost(&recent->addr));
3258 if (showhostnames)
3259 fflush(fp);
3260 if (mrulist_interrupted) {
3261 fputs("\n --interrupted--\n", fp);
3262 fflush(fp);
3263 break;
3264 }
3265 }
3266 fflush(fp);
3267 if (debug) {
3268 fprintf(stderr,
3269 "--- completed, freeing sorted[] pointers\n");
3270 fflush(stderr);
3271 }
3272 free(sorted);
3273
3274cleanup_return:
3275 if (debug) {
3276 fprintf(stderr, "... freeing MRU entries\n");
3277 fflush(stderr);
3278 }
3279 ITER_DLIST_BEGIN(mru_list, recent, mlink, mru)
3280 free(recent);
3281 ITER_DLIST_END()
3282 if (debug) {
3283 fprintf(stderr, "... freeing hash_table[]\n");
3284 fflush(stderr);
3285 }
3286 free(hash_table);
3287 hash_table = NULL;
3288 INIT_DLIST(mru_list, mlink);
3289
3290 pop_ctrl_c_handler(&mrulist_ctrl_c_hook);
3291}
3292
3293
3294/*
3295 * validate_ifnum - helper for ifstats()
3296 *
3297 * Ensures rows are received in order and complete.
3298 */
3299static void
3300validate_ifnum(
3301 FILE * fp,
3302 u_int ifnum,
3303 int * pfields,
3304 ifstats_row * prow
3305 )
3306{
3307 if (prow->ifnum == ifnum)
3308 return;
3309 if (prow->ifnum + 1 <= ifnum) {
3310 if (*pfields < IFSTATS_FIELDS)
3311 fprintf(fp, "Warning: incomplete row with %d (of %d) fields\n",
3312 *pfields, IFSTATS_FIELDS);
3313 *pfields = 0;
3314 prow->ifnum = ifnum;
3315 return;
3316 }
3317 fprintf(stderr,
3318 "received if index %u, have %d of %d fields for index %u, aborting.\n",
3319 ifnum, *pfields, IFSTATS_FIELDS, prow->ifnum);
3320 exit(1);
3321}
3322
3323
3324/*
3325 * another_ifstats_field - helper for ifstats()
3326 *
3327 * If all fields for the row have been received, print it.
3328 */
3329static void
3330another_ifstats_field(
3331 int * pfields,
3332 ifstats_row * prow,
3333 FILE * fp
3334 )
3335{
3336 u_int ifnum;
3337
3338 (*pfields)++;
3339 /* we understand 12 tags */
3340 if (IFSTATS_FIELDS > *pfields)
3341 return;
3342 /*
3343 " interface name send\n"
3344 " # address/broadcast drop flag ttl mc received sent failed peers uptime\n"
3345 "==============================================================================\n");
3346 */
3347 fprintf(fp,
3348 "%3u %-24.24s %c %4x %3u %2u %6u %6u %6u %5u %8d\n"
3349 " %s\n",
3350 prow->ifnum, prow->name,
3351 (prow->enabled)
3352 ? '.'
3353 : 'D',
3354 prow->flags, prow->ttl, prow->mcast_count,
3355 prow->received, prow->sent, prow->send_errors,
3356 prow->peer_count, prow->uptime, sptoa(&prow->addr));
3357 if (!SOCK_UNSPEC(&prow->bcast))
3358 fprintf(fp, " %s\n", sptoa(&prow->bcast));
3359 ifnum = prow->ifnum;
3360 ZERO(*prow);
3361 prow->ifnum = ifnum;
3362}
3363
3364
3365/*
3366 * ifstats - ntpq -c ifstats modeled on ntpdc -c ifstats.
3367 */
3368static void
3369ifstats(
3370 struct parse * pcmd,
3371 FILE * fp
3372 )
3373{
3374 const char addr_fmt[] = "addr.%u";
3375 const char bcast_fmt[] = "bcast.%u";
3376 const char en_fmt[] = "en.%u"; /* enabled */
3377 const char flags_fmt[] = "flags.%u";
3378 const char mc_fmt[] = "mc.%u"; /* mcast count */
3379 const char name_fmt[] = "name.%u";
3380 const char pc_fmt[] = "pc.%u"; /* peer count */
3381 const char rx_fmt[] = "rx.%u";
3382 const char tl_fmt[] = "tl.%u"; /* ttl */
3383 const char tx_fmt[] = "tx.%u";
3384 const char txerr_fmt[] = "txerr.%u";
3385 const char up_fmt[] = "up.%u"; /* uptime */
3386 const char * datap;
3387 int qres;
3388 size_t dsize;
3389 u_short rstatus;
3390 char * tag;
3391 char * val;
3392 int fields;
3393 u_int ui;
3394 ifstats_row row;
3395 int comprende;
3396 size_t len;
3397
3398 qres = doquery(CTL_OP_READ_ORDLIST_A, 0, TRUE, 0, NULL, &rstatus,
3399 &dsize, &datap);
3400 if (qres) /* message already displayed */
3401 return;
3402
3403 fprintf(fp,
3404 " interface name send\n"
3405 " # address/broadcast drop flag ttl mc received sent failed peers uptime\n"
3406 "==============================================================================\n");
3407 /* '=' x 78 */
3408
3409 ZERO(row);
3410 fields = 0;
3411 ui = 0;
3412 while (nextvar(&dsize, &datap, &tag, &val)) {
3413 INSIST(tag && val);
3414 if (debug > 1)
3415 fprintf(stderr, "nextvar gave: %s = %s\n", tag, val);
3416 comprende = FALSE;
3417 switch(tag[0]) {
3418
3419 case 'a':
3420 if (1 == sscanf(tag, addr_fmt, &ui) &&
3421 decodenetnum(val, &row.addr))
3422 comprende = TRUE;
3423 break;
3424
3425 case 'b':
3426 if (1 == sscanf(tag, bcast_fmt, &ui) &&
3427 ('\0' == *val ||
3428 decodenetnum(val, &row.bcast)))
3429 comprende = TRUE;
3430 break;
3431
3432 case 'e':
3433 if (1 == sscanf(tag, en_fmt, &ui) &&
3434 1 == sscanf(val, "%d", &row.enabled))
3435 comprende = TRUE;
3436 break;
3437
3438 case 'f':
3439 if (1 == sscanf(tag, flags_fmt, &ui) &&
3440 1 == sscanf(val, "0x%x", &row.flags))
3441 comprende = TRUE;
3442 break;
3443
3444 case 'm':
3445 if (1 == sscanf(tag, mc_fmt, &ui) &&
3446 1 == sscanf(val, "%u", &row.mcast_count))
3447 comprende = TRUE;
3448 break;
3449
3450 case 'n':
3451 if (1 == sscanf(tag, name_fmt, &ui)) {
3452 /* strip quotes */
3453 len = strlen(val);
3454 if (len >= 2 &&
3455 len - 2 < sizeof(row.name)) {
3456 len -= 2;
3457 memcpy(row.name, val + 1, len);
3458 row.name[len] = '\0';
3459 comprende = TRUE;
3460 }
3461 }
3462 break;
3463
3464 case 'p':
3465 if (1 == sscanf(tag, pc_fmt, &ui) &&
3466 1 == sscanf(val, "%u", &row.peer_count))
3467 comprende = TRUE;
3468 break;
3469
3470 case 'r':
3471 if (1 == sscanf(tag, rx_fmt, &ui) &&
3472 1 == sscanf(val, "%u", &row.received))
3473 comprende = TRUE;
3474 break;
3475
3476 case 't':
3477 if (1 == sscanf(tag, tl_fmt, &ui) &&
3478 1 == sscanf(val, "%u", &row.ttl))
3479 comprende = TRUE;
3480 else if (1 == sscanf(tag, tx_fmt, &ui) &&
3481 1 == sscanf(val, "%u", &row.sent))
3482 comprende = TRUE;
3483 else if (1 == sscanf(tag, txerr_fmt, &ui) &&
3484 1 == sscanf(val, "%u", &row.send_errors))
3485 comprende = TRUE;
3486 break;
3487
3488 case 'u':
3489 if (1 == sscanf(tag, up_fmt, &ui) &&
3490 1 == sscanf(val, "%u", &row.uptime))
3491 comprende = TRUE;
3492 break;
3493 }
3494
3495 if (comprende) {
3496 /* error out if rows out of order */
3497 validate_ifnum(fp, ui, &fields, &row);
3498 /* if the row is complete, print it */
3499 another_ifstats_field(&fields, &row, fp);
3500 }
3501 }
3502 if (fields != IFSTATS_FIELDS)
3503 fprintf(fp, "Warning: incomplete row with %d (of %d) fields\n",
3504 fields, IFSTATS_FIELDS);
3505
3506 fflush(fp);
3507}
3508
3509
3510/*
3511 * validate_reslist_idx - helper for reslist()
3512 *
3513 * Ensures rows are received in order and complete.
3514 */
3515static void
3516validate_reslist_idx(
3517 FILE * fp,
3518 u_int idx,
3519 int * pfields,
3520 reslist_row * prow
3521 )
3522{
3523 if (prow->idx == idx)
3524 return;
3525 if (prow->idx + 1 == idx) {
3526 if (*pfields < RESLIST_FIELDS)
3527 fprintf(fp, "Warning: incomplete row with %d (of %d) fields",
3528 *pfields, RESLIST_FIELDS);
3529 *pfields = 0;
3530 prow->idx = idx;
3531 return;
3532 }
3533 fprintf(stderr,
3534 "received reslist index %u, have %d of %d fields for index %u, aborting.\n",
3535 idx, *pfields, RESLIST_FIELDS, prow->idx);
3536 exit(1);
3537}
3538
3539
3540/*
3541 * another_reslist_field - helper for reslist()
3542 *
3543 * If all fields for the row have been received, print it.
3544 */
3545static void
3546another_reslist_field(
3547 int * pfields,
3548 reslist_row * prow,
3549 FILE * fp
3550 )
3551{
3552 char addrmaskstr[128];
3553 int prefix; /* subnet mask as prefix bits count */
3554 u_int idx;
3555
3556 (*pfields)++;
3557 /* we understand 4 tags */
3558 if (RESLIST_FIELDS > *pfields)
3559 return;
3560
3561 prefix = sockaddr_masktoprefixlen(&prow->mask);
3562 if (prefix >= 0)
3563 snprintf(addrmaskstr, sizeof(addrmaskstr), "%s/%d",
3564 stoa(&prow->addr), prefix);
3565 else
3566 snprintf(addrmaskstr, sizeof(addrmaskstr), "%s %s",
3567 stoa(&prow->addr), stoa(&prow->mask));
3568
3569 /*
3570 " hits addr/prefix or addr mask\n"
3571 " restrictions\n"
3572 "==============================================================================\n");
3573 */
3574 fprintf(fp,
3575 "%10lu %s\n"
3576 " %s\n",
3577 prow->hits, addrmaskstr, prow->flagstr);
3578 idx = prow->idx;
3579 ZERO(*prow);
3580 prow->idx = idx;
3581}
3582
3583
3584/*
3585 * reslist - ntpq -c reslist modeled on ntpdc -c reslist.
3586 */
3587static void
3588reslist(
3589 struct parse * pcmd,
3590 FILE * fp
3591 )
3592{
3593 const char addr_fmtu[] = "addr.%u";
3594 const char mask_fmtu[] = "mask.%u";
3595 const char hits_fmt[] = "hits.%u";
3596 const char flags_fmt[] = "flags.%u";
3597 const char qdata[] = "addr_restrictions";
3598 const int qdata_chars = COUNTOF(qdata) - 1;
3599 const char * datap;
3600 int qres;
3601 size_t dsize;
3602 u_short rstatus;
3603 char * tag;
3604 char * val;
3605 int fields;
3606 u_int ui;
3607 reslist_row row;
3608 int comprende;
3609 size_t len;
3610
3611 qres = doquery(CTL_OP_READ_ORDLIST_A, 0, TRUE, qdata_chars,
3612 qdata, &rstatus, &dsize, &datap);
3613 if (qres) /* message already displayed */
3614 return;
3615
3616 fprintf(fp,
3617 " hits addr/prefix or addr mask\n"
3618 " restrictions\n"
3619 "==============================================================================\n");
3620 /* '=' x 78 */
3621
3622 ZERO(row);
3623 fields = 0;
3624 ui = 0;
3625 while (nextvar(&dsize, &datap, &tag, &val)) {
3626 INSIST(tag && val);
3627 if (debug > 1)
3628 fprintf(stderr, "nextvar gave: %s = %s\n", tag, val);
3629 comprende = FALSE;
3630 switch(tag[0]) {
3631
3632 case 'a':
3633 if (1 == sscanf(tag, addr_fmtu, &ui) &&
3634 decodenetnum(val, &row.addr))
3635 comprende = TRUE;
3636 break;
3637
3638 case 'f':
3639 if (1 == sscanf(tag, flags_fmt, &ui)) {
3640 if (NULL == val) {
3641 row.flagstr[0] = '\0';
3642 comprende = TRUE;
3643 } else if ((len = strlen(val)) < sizeof(row.flagstr)) {
3644 memcpy(row.flagstr, val, len);
3645 row.flagstr[len] = '\0';
3646 comprende = TRUE;
3647 } else {
3648 /* no flags, and still !comprende */
3649 row.flagstr[0] = '\0';
3650 }
3651 }
3652 break;
3653
3654 case 'h':
3655 if (1 == sscanf(tag, hits_fmt, &ui) &&
3656 1 == sscanf(val, "%lu", &row.hits))
3657 comprende = TRUE;
3658 break;
3659
3660 case 'm':
3661 if (1 == sscanf(tag, mask_fmtu, &ui) &&
3662 decodenetnum(val, &row.mask))
3663 comprende = TRUE;
3664 break;
3665 }
3666
3667 if (comprende) {
3668 /* error out if rows out of order */
3669 validate_reslist_idx(fp, ui, &fields, &row);
3670 /* if the row is complete, print it */
3671 another_reslist_field(&fields, &row, fp);
3672 }
3673 }
3674 if (fields != RESLIST_FIELDS)
3675 fprintf(fp, "Warning: incomplete row with %d (of %d) fields",
3676 fields, RESLIST_FIELDS);
3677
3678 fflush(fp);
3679}
3680
3681
3682/*
3683 * collect_display_vdc
3684 */
3685static void
3686collect_display_vdc(
3687 associd_t as,
3688 vdc * table,
3689 int decodestatus,
3690 FILE * fp
3691 )
3692{
3693 static const char * const suf[2] = { "adr", "port" };
3694 static const char * const leapbits[4] = { "00", "01",
3695 "10", "11" };
3696 struct varlist vl[MAXLIST];
3697 char tagbuf[32];
3698 vdc *pvdc;
3699 u_short rstatus;
3700 size_t rsize;
3701 const char *rdata;
3702 int qres;
3703 char *tag;
3704 char *val;
3705 u_int n;
3706 size_t len;
3707 int match;
3708 u_long ul;
3709 int vtype;
3710
3711 ZERO(vl);
3712 for (pvdc = table; pvdc->tag != NULL; pvdc++) {
3713 ZERO(pvdc->v);
3714 if (NTP_ADD != pvdc->type) {
3715 doaddvlist(vl, pvdc->tag);
3716 } else {
3717 for (n = 0; n < COUNTOF(suf); n++) {
3718 snprintf(tagbuf, sizeof(tagbuf), "%s%s",
3719 pvdc->tag, suf[n]);
3720 doaddvlist(vl, tagbuf);
3721 }
3722 }
3723 }
3724 qres = doquerylist(vl, CTL_OP_READVAR, as, 0, &rstatus, &rsize,
3725 &rdata);
3726 doclearvlist(vl);
3727 if (qres)
3728 return; /* error msg already displayed */
3729
3730 /*
3731 * iterate over the response variables filling vdc_table with
3732 * the retrieved values.
3733 */
3734 while (nextvar(&rsize, &rdata, &tag, &val)) {
3735 INSIST(tag && val);
3736 n = 0;
3737 for (pvdc = table; pvdc->tag != NULL; pvdc++) {
3738 len = strlen(pvdc->tag);
3739 if (strncmp(tag, pvdc->tag, len))
3740 continue;
3741 if (NTP_ADD != pvdc->type) {
3742 if ('\0' != tag[len])
3743 continue;
3744 break;
3745 }
3746 match = FALSE;
3747 for (n = 0; n < COUNTOF(suf); n++) {
3748 if (strcmp(tag + len, suf[n]))
3749 continue;
3750 match = TRUE;
3751 break;
3752 }
3753 if (match)
3754 break;
3755 }
3756 if (NULL == pvdc->tag)
3757 continue;
3758 switch (pvdc->type) {
3759
3760 case NTP_STR:
3761 /* strip surrounding double quotes */
3762 if ('"' == val[0]) {
3763 len = strlen(val);
3764 if (len > 0 && '"' == val[len - 1]) {
3765 val[len - 1] = '\0';
3766 val++;
3767 }
3768 }
3769 /* fallthru */
3770 case NTP_MODE: /* fallthru */
3771 case NTP_2BIT:
3772 pvdc->v.str = estrdup(val);
3773 break;
3774
3775 case NTP_LFP:
3776 decodets(val, &pvdc->v.lfp);
3777 break;
3778
3779 case NTP_ADP:
3780 if (!decodenetnum(val, &pvdc->v.sau))
3781 fprintf(stderr, "malformed %s=%s\n",
3782 pvdc->tag, val);
3783 break;
3784
3785 case NTP_ADD:
3786 if (0 == n) { /* adr */
3787 if (!decodenetnum(val, &pvdc->v.sau))
3788 fprintf(stderr,
3789 "malformed %s=%s\n",
3790 pvdc->tag, val);
3791 } else { /* port */
3792 if (atouint(val, &ul))
3793 SET_PORT(&pvdc->v.sau,
3794 (u_short)ul);
3795 }
3796 break;
3797 }
3798 }
3799
3800 /* and display */
3801 if (decodestatus) {
3802 vtype = (0 == as)
3803 ? TYPE_SYS
3804 : TYPE_PEER;
3805 fprintf(fp, "associd=%u status=%04x %s,\n", as, rstatus,
3806 statustoa(vtype, rstatus));
3807 }
3808
3809 for (pvdc = table; pvdc->tag != NULL; pvdc++) {
3810 switch (pvdc->type) {
3811
3812 case NTP_STR:
3813 if (pvdc->v.str != NULL) {
3814 fprintf(fp, "%s %s\n", pvdc->display,
3815 pvdc->v.str);
3816 free(pvdc->v.str);
3817 pvdc->v.str = NULL;
3818 }
3819 break;
3820
3821 case NTP_ADD: /* fallthru */
3822 case NTP_ADP:
3823 fprintf(fp, "%s %s\n", pvdc->display,
3824 nntohostp(&pvdc->v.sau));
3825 break;
3826
3827 case NTP_LFP:
3828 fprintf(fp, "%s %s\n", pvdc->display,
3829 prettydate(&pvdc->v.lfp));
3830 break;
3831
3832 case NTP_MODE:
3833 atouint(pvdc->v.str, &ul);
3834 fprintf(fp, "%s %s\n", pvdc->display,
3835 modetoa((int)ul));
3836 break;
3837
3838 case NTP_2BIT:
3839 atouint(pvdc->v.str, &ul);
3840 fprintf(fp, "%s %s\n", pvdc->display,
3841 leapbits[ul & 0x3]);
3842 break;
3843
3844 default:
3845 fprintf(stderr, "unexpected vdc type %d for %s\n",
3846 pvdc->type, pvdc->tag);
3847 break;
3848 }
3849 }
3850}
3851

3854 * sysstats - implements ntpq -c sysstats modeled on ntpdc -c sysstats
3855 */
3856static void
3857sysstats(
3858 struct parse *pcmd,
3859 FILE *fp
3860 )
3861{
3862 static vdc sysstats_vdc[] = {
3863 VDC_INIT("ss_uptime", "uptime: ", NTP_STR),
3864 VDC_INIT("ss_reset", "sysstats reset: ", NTP_STR),
3865 VDC_INIT("ss_received", "packets received: ", NTP_STR),
3866 VDC_INIT("ss_thisver", "current version: ", NTP_STR),
3867 VDC_INIT("ss_oldver", "older version: ", NTP_STR),
3868 VDC_INIT("ss_badformat", "bad length or format: ", NTP_STR),
3869 VDC_INIT("ss_badauth", "authentication failed:", NTP_STR),
3870 VDC_INIT("ss_declined", "declined: ", NTP_STR),
3871 VDC_INIT("ss_restricted", "restricted: ", NTP_STR),
3872 VDC_INIT("ss_limited", "rate limited: ", NTP_STR),
3873 VDC_INIT("ss_kodsent", "KoD responses: ", NTP_STR),
3874 VDC_INIT("ss_processed", "processed for time: ", NTP_STR),
3875#if 0
3876 VDC_INIT("ss_lamport", "Lamport violations: ", NTP_STR),
3877 VDC_INIT("ss_tsrounding", "bad timestamp rounding:", NTP_STR),
3878#endif
3879 VDC_INIT(NULL, NULL, 0)
3880 };
3881
3882 collect_display_vdc(0, sysstats_vdc, FALSE, fp);
3883}

4050/*
4051 * pstats - show statistics for a peer
4052 */
4053static void
4054pstats(
4055 struct parse *pcmd,
4056 FILE *fp
4057 )
4058{
4059 static vdc pstats_vdc[] = {
4060 VDC_INIT("src", "remote host: ", NTP_ADD),
4061 VDC_INIT("dst", "local address: ", NTP_ADD),
4062 VDC_INIT("timerec", "time last received: ", NTP_STR),
4063 VDC_INIT("timer", "time until next send:", NTP_STR),
4064 VDC_INIT("timereach", "reachability change: ", NTP_STR),
4065 VDC_INIT("sent", "packets sent: ", NTP_STR),
4066 VDC_INIT("received", "packets received: ", NTP_STR),
4067 VDC_INIT("badauth", "bad authentication: ", NTP_STR),
4068 VDC_INIT("bogusorg", "bogus origin: ", NTP_STR),
4069 VDC_INIT("oldpkt", "duplicate: ", NTP_STR),
4070 VDC_INIT("seldisp", "bad dispersion: ", NTP_STR),
4071 VDC_INIT("selbroken", "bad reference time: ", NTP_STR),
4072 VDC_INIT("candidate", "candidate order: ", NTP_STR),
4073 VDC_INIT(NULL, NULL, 0)
4074 };
4075 associd_t associd;
4076
4077 associd = checkassocid(pcmd->argval[0].uval);
4078 if (0 == associd)
4079 return;
4080
4081 collect_display_vdc(associd, pstats_vdc, TRUE, fp);
4082}
